The second dose: adolescents - 10,690, pregnant women - 1,141, nursing women - 2,749.
The plumber who found money in the church wall will be paid 20 thousand dollars
A plumber who found money in the wall of a church in the US state of Texas will be paid a reward.
This was reported in a press release of the non-profit organization Crime Stoppers of Houston.
The incident took place in a large evangelical church in Lakewood, where Pastor Joel Austin preaches, promising that riches and prosperity await devout Christians.
In November 2021, plumber Justin Cowley repaired one of the church toilets and found thousands of bags of money and checks under thermal insulation.
He gave the find to the church and, according to him, did not even receive gratitude from Austin.
"I wanted to hear him say," You know, Justin, you did the right thing.
We understand what you did and what you could do, "KPRC-TV quotes him.
Apparently, the find is related to a theft that occurred in Lakewood Church seven years ago.
Then about 200 thousand dollars in cash and 400 thousand dollars in the form of checks, which were stored in the church safe, disappeared.
The money was insured, so the church did not suffer losses.
Nevertheless, a reward of 25 thousand dollars was announced for information about the criminals.
Justin Cowley could not claim this amount, as the award had already expired.
Despite this, the non-profit organization Crime Stoppers of Houston, which at one time donated five thousand dollars for the award and later received another 20 thousand dollars as a gift from Lakewood Church, decided to reward the plumber's honesty.
He will receive 20 thousand dollars.
Earlier it was reported that the police questioned Pastor Joel Austin about the money found in the wall of Lakewood Church.

A new case of human infection with bird flu virus was recorded in China
A new case of human infection with the highly pathogenic H5N6 bird flu virus has been recorded in China.
This was reported by the radio station RTHK with reference to the notification of the Hong Kong health authorities, TASS reports.
A 68-year-old resident of the Huizhou city district in the southern province of Guangdong, who kept poultry on the farm, became infected.
His condition is assessed by doctors as critical.
The world's first human infection with the H5N6 virus strain was recorded in May 2014 in the southwestern province of Sichuan.
Since then, the number of such cases in the country has reached 53.
In Brazil, citizens were obliged to present vaccination passports when entering the country
In Brazil, it was obliged to require covid passports from those entering the territory of the state, the corresponding decision was made by the judge of the Federal Supreme Court of Brazil (STF) Luiz Roberto Barroso.
This is reported by CNN Brasil.
Citizens who have contraindications to vaccination are exempt from presenting a certificate of vaccination.
Also included in the list of exceptions are persons who came from countries where the absence of a vaccine is proven.
"The situation is even more serious, given that Brazil is a popular tourist destination for New Year's, pre-carnival and carnival parties, as well as other events, which implies an increase in tourist traffic," Barroso said.
Earlier, the Brazilian authorities obliged tourists who were not vaccinated against coronavirus infection to observe a five-day quarantine.
The scheme of full protection against COVID-19 is revealed
Virologist, Doctor of Medical Sciences, Honored Worker of Science of Russia Anatoly Altshtein in an interview with Ura.ru revealed a scheme of full protection against coronavirus infection.
According to him, this can be achieved by introducing an injection and using a nasal vaccine.
With internasal use, immunoglobulins A are formed in large quantities. When the vaccine is injected, this does not happen.
Immunoglobulins A protect the mucous membrane, so the virus cannot enter the body.
And inside after vaccination, we have the most immunoglobulins G (antibodies).
And if you introduce both vaccines, you will get a lot of immunoglobulins A and G. But so far there is no decision on double vaccination, "the doctor said.
Chief preventive specialist of the Urals Federal District, Doctor of Medical Sciences Sergey Tokarev, in turn, said that the main advantage of using nasal vaccination together with injection is the ability to stop being a carrier of COVID-19.
He added that this will help the fact that in this case, the protection of the body, presumably, should be maximum.
Earlier, the Minister of Health of the Nizhny Novgorod Region, David Melik-Huseynov, said that the spread of a new coronavirus infection among children would lead to a new surge in the COVID-19 pandemic.
According to him, this is the pattern observed in other countries, where the next wave of the pandemic came earlier.

From February next year, unvaccinated people will have to pay a fine of 3,600 euros.

Some were holding posters saying "This is a false pandemic," "I will not be vaccinated."

In the autonomous community, a covid certificate is mandatory for access to bars, restaurants, gyms, nursing homes and night entertainment venues.
The decision to introduce sanitary passports was made by the authorities of a number of regions of the country against the background of an increase in the number of cases of coronavirus infection.

The action began peacefully, but then turned into clashes with the guards.

WHO found "omicron" already in six dozen states
The World Health Organization (WHO) said that a new strain of coronavirus "omicron" has already been identified in 63 countries.
A number of experts already say that the spread of the new strain can have catastrophic consequences.
The rate of spread of the strain was reported in the WHO report.
According to the organization, as of December 9, the strain has already been identified in 63 countries, in all six WHO regions.
This is despite the fact that it began to actively spread only from the end of November.
WHO also expresses concern about the high rate of spread of the new variant of coronavirus.
WHO experts express concern that, according to preliminary data, the new strain may bypass the delta strain, which is also the Indian version of the coronavirus, which is now leading in all countries without exception.
Prior to this, the Director General of the World Health Organization, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, said that the omicron strain could have a significant impact on the course of the coronavirus pandemic.
Similar conclusions were also reached in the UK.
Experts of the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine (LSHTM) believe that "omicron" will replace "delta" in the coming months.
And the number of cases in Britain alone will be about 1 million. This is despite the fact that officially several hundred people are currently sick with "omicron" in the Kingdom, and according to estimates up to 10 thousand.
British experts predict tens of thousands of deaths from the omicron strain, and at its peak, more than 2,000 people will be taken to hospitals every day.
What the British health system will not be able to cope with.
The situation is complicated by the fact that, according to recent studies, the effectiveness of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine against the omicron strain is 32 times lower compared to other types of the disease.
How the Russian Sputnik V reacts to the omicron is still unknown - this will become clear in the next few weeks.
The Gamalei Center has just started testing the Russian vaccine on the omicron strain.

In Brazil, as a result of rains killed seven people
At least seven people were killed and 175 injured as a result of heavy rains that hit the northeastern Brazilian state of Bahia and neighboring Minas Gerais.
This is reported in TASS with reference to the rescue services.
An extratropical cyclone has been raging on the border of these states since the middle of the week, as a result of which the level of precipitation in the region has reached 450 mm. A state of emergency has been declared in 25 municipalities of the state of Bahia, in some of them the floods have become the most destructive in 35 years.
The disaster destroyed several bridges, two river dams, blocked traffic on three routes.
According to rescuers, about 5.7 thousand people were left homeless, another 6.7 thousand were forced to leave their homes.
The damage from the disaster affected more than 85,000 residents of the region.

$135 billion went to applications - Hi-Tech
In 2021, user spending in applications grew by 25% worldwide, and the number of downloads - by 8%.
The most popular in the world were various video services.
Most users downloaded the CapCut video editor, and spent the most on YouTube.
Both the number of application downloads and user spending in them showed a significant increase in the period from January to November 2021.
The number of downloads increased by 8%, reaching 140 billion. User spending in applications increased even more significantly: by 25%, to a record $135 billion.
Such data was published by the analytical company App Annie, which presented a report on the mobile application market in 2021.
In 2021, the global economy emerged from the lockdown and began a post-pandemic recovery.
"Will such a" return to physical "slow down the growth of the application economy? Not at all," the authors of the report believe.
India has become the leader in the number of app downloads: it accounts for about 20% of all downloads.
It is followed by the USA (9%) and Brazil (8%).
Users of gadgets on iOS, as before, spent more than users with Android: iOS accounted for 65% of all expenses in applications.
Among applications, the CapCut video editor took the first place in terms of the number of downloads in 2021.
It is followed by two Indian applications: the video service MX TakaTak and the online trading application Meesho.
The top 10 in terms of the number of downloads also includes Telegram.
In general, judging by the number of downloads, VPN services are popular among users (there are two of them in the top 10 - VPN Master and NightOwl VPN) and services related to video creation and broadcast (in addition to CapCut and MX TakaTak, two other such services - Moj and SnackVideo - are in the top 10).
"Users spent the most in applications for live broadcasts and online streaming," the authors of the report note.
YouTube is the leader here, the top 5 in terms of user spending also includes the video service TikTok, video streaming services Disney+ and HBO Max, as well as the Japanese manga subscription service Piccoma.
The first places in terms of the number of monthly active users are occupied by Telegram, Instagram, Zoom and TikTok, the top 5 is closed by the mobile version of Microsoft Office.
In Russia, the leader in the number of downloads for the year was the shopping application AliExpress.
It is followed by the Zenly service, which shows the location of friends, and the same CapCut.
Also in the top 10 applications include: online karaoke StarMaker, online clothing retailer Shein, Maps for Minecraft PE application, online taxi ordering service DiDi, YouTube client Pure Tuber, retailer Dixie app and online store Scooter.
Around the world, people have adapted to the pandemic through the transition to life in mobile, which can be called one of the main conclusions.
The most successful industries were those that helped people to be closer both virtually and personally, "commented Lexi Sidow, head of marketing research at App Annie.
The revenue of the mobile games sector in 2021 reached $90 billion. The leaders in the number of downloads were casual and hypercasual games, in which there is no or almost no plot, and video design is minimal.
The top 3 most popular games in the world included Count Masters, Project Makeover and Bridge Race.
In Russia, the leading games are DOP 2: Delete One Part, Going Balls and Phone Case DIY.
Earlier, App Annie presented its forecast for 2022.
Among the main trends of the next year, the company's analysts named the growth in the number of TikTok users to 1.5 billion, the growth in the popularity of financial applications, such as the Robinhood investor application, among generation Z, and the further increase in the popularity of metaversion mobile games.
Clan De File for dogs with beef, 30 pcs. of 40 g.
Natural dried delicacy for dogs of all breeds and ages from beef.
Clan De File is a meat fillet for dogs with beef, and nothing more.
Natural dried delicacy for dogs of all breeds and ages.

Recommended daily diet: no more than 10% of the daily diet of an adult animal.

Russians warned of a new scheme of fraudsters
The attackers began to look for new maneuvers for fraud in video messages.
Izvestia writes about this with reference to experts.
According to Ivideon's product director Zaur Abutalimov, the main danger associated with the spread of video communication means is dipfaces.
In this case, the fraudsters create a fake video based on real records involving the victim.
Thanks to this, the neural network is able to accurately reproduce the behavior of a person.
Abutalimov added that using a dipfake, attackers can call the victim's acquaintances via video link or create a video with a copy of a person for distribution for the purpose of blackmail.
"Such fakes can easily provoke bullying, since a savvy attacker can put people in ridiculous, dangerous or compromising pseudo-scenarios," the expert said.
Varonis leading system engineer Alexander Vetkol, in turn, noted that psychologically people trust others more when they see them.
He stressed that this could create specific risks when it comes to technologies using video.

Listed five actions that will help avoid diabetes
Problems with blood sugar are among the most common in the world.
However, some do not attach much importance to this, and in vain.
Diabetes can eventually lead to severe complications and even death.
Preventive measures play a major role in preventing the formation of diseases.
So, doctors recommend changing the drinking regime - reducing the number of various drinks and switching to ordinary water have a positive effect on metabolism.
Sweet foods raise blood sugar levels to a dangerous level when consumed in excess.
Therefore, the first step towards a healthy lifestyle is to stop buying sweets and store them at home.
The appearance of the disease is affected not only by improper nutrition, but also by habits.
To reduce the risks of diabetes, you need to move a lot.
Experts advise to adhere to a low-carbohydrate diet.
Such a diet will not only help reduce weight, but also protect against sharp fluctuations in sugar levels.
To protect against diabetes, you need to eat a lot of fiber.
Dietary fibers fill the stomach and thus contribute to a feeling of satiety, the release of digestive juices and increase food absorption.

The flesh is juicy, with a sugar taste.
The hybrid is resistant to a complex of diseases.
Recommended for making salads, snacks and slicing.
Seedling: in late March - early April.
Picking - in the phase of the first real sheet.
Planting seedlings in greenhouses - in May.
After planting in the open ground, the plants are formed and tied.

Dr. Pavlova spoke about "weekend migraine" in workaholics
Several factors can lead to deterioration of well-being on the weekend
The reason for the deterioration of well-being after working days is often "weekend migraine," said a well-known endocrinologist, candidate of medical sciences, senior researcher at the Faculty of Fundamental Medicine of Moscow State University, scientific director of the System Medicine Clinic Zukhra Pavlova in her telegram channel.
According to her, workaholics especially often suffer from this, who have a headache, brokenness and weakness on weekends.
Dr. Pavlova noted that in addition to the fatigue accumulated during the week, there are quite a lot of objective reasons for the negative reaction of the body to changing conditions.
On weekends, our life changes radically.
"We sleep for a long time, we lie on the couch all day, most likely we eat more, and drink less," the doctor argued.
Due to overeating and lack of water - heaviness and brokenness. "
An additional role is played by the late rise.
So, if you get up three hours later than usual, then there will be a reaction called jet lag.
It occurs in travelers who cross several time zones.
To determine which of the factors plays a decisive role in the deterioration of well-being, Pavlova recommended tracking what changes the most on the weekend.

The reinforced perimeter of high-density foam significantly increases the service life of the mattress.
Mattress "Optimal Hard S1000" with different sides of stiffness, total height of the mattress 23 cm.
The maximum permissible load per bed is up to 140 kg.

Each spring is located in a separate fabric pocket, which allows you to correctly distribute the load of the body.

Cotton jacquard quilted on 2 cm thick artificial latex and 1 cm Hollcon material, which provides additional comfort.

Impregnation ensures the complete destruction of mold fungi, prevents the development of microorganisms, dust mites and microbes.
The mattress is equipped with four comfortable handles for turning over, as well as aerators for additional ventilation of layers.
South African scientists announce low effectiveness of Pfizer vaccine against "omicron"
South Africa announces low effectiveness of Pfizer vaccine against "omicron"
Scientists of the Republic of South Africa conducted a study and reported on the low effectiveness of the Pfizer vaccine against the omicron strain of coronavirus infection.
According to estimates, it (the level of neutralization of "omicron") corresponds to the (level of) effectiveness of the vaccine of 22.5% against infection with symptoms, which is why... the ability of the vaccine to protect against infection is questioned, says the text of the study published on the MedRxiv portal.
At the same time, experts clarified that the drug can save from the severe course of the disease.
Earlier, the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine predicted that the omicron strain of coronavirus could cause a new wave of pandemic in the UK with more frequent hospitalizations than a year ago.
How much hidden sugar in familiar foods?
Sugar is not the best source of beneficial nutrients.
Its excess in the diet can lead to type 2 diabetes, as well as cause cardiovascular and oncological diseases.
Consumers should take into account that under an unfamiliar word in the composition of the product, hidden sugar can be indicated - an ingredient similar to sugar in calorie content, composition and glycemic index.
On the label can be presented several dozen names, in fact, denoting sugar.
One of the most common and common names is glucose and fructose.
There may also be other hidden sugars such as dextrose (sugar obtained from corn), levulose (fruit sugar), molasses (black molasses), agave syrup, etc.
These are all simple carbohydrates that belong to mono- and disaccharides, and they can be not only in confectionery, but also in ketchup, doctor's sausage, bread, etc.
According to Roskachestvo, the most effective way to reduce sugar consumption is to eat whole and unprocessed foods, as well as pay attention to the label and many different names of sugar.
Different types of sugar differ in taste, but whatever the name of the ingredient in the product - syrup or nectar, processed or unprocessed, brown or white - it still remains sugar.
It is not easy to calculate the exact amount of sugar, since it is necessary to take into account not only the amount of sugar indicated by the manufacturer on the package, but also the fact that vegetables, fruits, etc. initially contain a certain amount of sugar.
Thus, the total amount of sugar may be significantly higher than indicated on the label.
German Chancellor Scholz: gas will lose importance for Germany in 25 years
The new German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said that gas imports are losing importance for Germany, as the country continues the transition to decarbonization of the economy.
According to him, Germany plans to completely abandon gas, oil and coal by 2045, becoming a climate neutral country.
"That is, in 25 years the world will be such that the issue of gas transportation to Germany and Europe will play a different role," the chancellor said.
Scholz noted that Germany remains committed to ensuring that Ukraine transports Russian natural gas in the future, as at the moment this resource is important for the energy transition.
He recalled that Germany and the United States made a statement in which Berlin's support for the energy transformation of Ukraine was recorded.
Earlier, German Foreign Minister Annalena Berbock said that the process of certification of the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline continues.
According to the minister, within the framework of the coalition negotiations and the discussion of the coalition agreement, it was stated that European law in the field of energy should be applied to energy projects.
The diplomat also pointed out that the pipeline "does not meet the requirements" of the European Union.

Hackers hacked Indian Prime Minister's Twitter
Hackers hacked the Twitter account of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
The attackers managed to publish a fake message.
It was reported that India allegedly recognized bitcoin as a legal tender, and that the country had already purchased cryptocurrency.
Modi's office asked him to ignore the new messages.
Representatives of the prime minister said that Twitter reacted quickly - access to the account was restored.

In the referendum in New Caledonia, the majority voted against independence
In New Caledonia, the third referendum, held on 12 December, ended with the same result as the previous two.
According to the first partial results, announced on Sunday, December 12, at noon, the majority of New Caledonians voted in a referendum against the independence of their territory.
At the same time, the level of participation in this third vote was significantly lower than in the previous two.
According to preliminary results published by local authorities, 3.51% (2,755 people) of voters voted "for" the independence of New Caledonia from France, while 96.49% (75,762) voted "against."
The turnout was 43.90%, more than 80,000 New Caledonians took part in the elections.
As France-Presse comments on these interim results, "the outcome of these elections left no room for doubt," as supporters of independence called on voters not to vote.
As the initiators of the referendum, they opposed its holding on December 12, believing that the new outbreak of the COVID-19 epidemic in the archipelago prevents a full and "honest" election campaign.
Thus, this non-participation opened the way for a third victory for the supporters of French New Caledonia, after the referendums held in November 2018 and October 2020.
In 2018, 56.7% of residents voted against independence, in 2020 - 53.3%.
According to the separatists, they do not recognize the results of the last vote and will challenge them in the UN.
As reported on Sunday, December 12, at the Elysee Palace, French President Emmanuel Macron is to speak on the results of this referendum.
The theme of New Caledonia's independence in many ways revived the last weeks of the presidential campaign in France.
Several presidential candidates spoke in favor of the territory remaining part of France, as it is "the last region of the European Union's presence in the Pacific."
"New Caledonia must remain French," Eric Zemmur repeated repeatedly.
The same statement was made by Republican candidate Valerie Pecresse, who published a column in Le Figaro at the end of October, urging Caledonians to remain French.
For his part, Emmanuel Macron announced in May 2018 that he would not take a position "because it is not his responsibility."
Nevertheless, the president added: "France would be less beautiful without New Caledonia."
Prime Minister Jean Castex, for his part, expressed "a strong desire that the choice of Caledonians be the choice of France."

The world's first drone with laser weapons tested in Turkey
Turkey successfully tested the world's first drone with laser weapons.
The Eren UAV was tested at a distance of 100 to 500 m, MIR24 reports.
The device is capable of neutralizing explosive objects at a distance using a laser.
The maximum flight height of the novelty reaches 3 thousand m.
After passing the relevant tests, the UAV should enter the service of the Turkish military, which will use it to destroy explosive devices without the involvement of deminers.
The agency emphasizes that Turkey is among the six countries in the world capable of developing and producing its own drones.

Ukraine to start producing new generation jet drones
The new Ukrainian-Turkish plant will begin to create jet unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) of the ANKA type.
This was announced on December 11 by the freelance adviser to the head of the office of the Ukrainian president Alexey Arestovich.
That is, they are able to act against air objects, against other drones.
Even against manned aircraft.
They will have Ukrainian engines and the rest of the Turkish avionics: the hull and the like, "Dialog.ua quotes him.
Commenting on the main features of the ANKA devices, Arestovich said that it was a jet, not a piston UAV.
According to him, this is a new generation of drones after Bayraktar, which exceed it "in all characteristics."
The first batch of UAVs should be produced by the plant at the end of next year, concluded Arestovich.
The ANKA aircraft was created by the Turkish Aerospace Agency in February 2014.
The development of the drone has been conducted by the Turkish authorities in cooperation with a number of private companies since 2010.
The day before, the Ukrainian General Staff classified data on the use of Bayraktar drones and Javelin missile systems during military operations of the combined forces in Donbass.
On December 6, the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky announced that the construction of a plant for the production of modern military drones had begun in the country.
According to him, Ukraine intends to use drones.
On September 29, Bayraktar Savunma and the Ukrainian Ministry of Defense signed an agreement on the construction of a center in the Kiev region, which will conduct training of personnel, as well as testing and maintenance of Turkish Bayraktar UAVs.
The press service of the Ukrainian leader's office called the memorandum "a big real step forward."
Two lions escaped from a container at the airport
Lions escaped at Singapore's Changi airport.
This is reported by The Straits Times.
Two predators managed to get out of a container with seven lions, which arrived on one of the planes.
The publication notes that it remains unknown from which country they were brought to Singapore, and where they were going.
One of the runaway lions lay on the roof of the container.
The animals could not move away from him because of the protective net installed nearby.
The confrontation ended after the arrival at the airport of employees of the Mandai Wildlife Group, which is in charge of all Singaporean zoos.
They immobilized the lions with darts with a tranquilizer and plan to deliver them to a quarantine facility.
Earlier it was reported that in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, a lion escaped from its owner and walked through the streets of the city.
On the same day, the animal voluntarily returned home, people were not injured.
Experts warned about the threat of cancer due to vitamin B9
Studies suggest that excess vitamin B9, also known as folic acid, can lead to cancer.
The Daily Express warned about this.
According to experts, there is strong evidence that people who do not lack folic acid are less likely to get some types of cancer, in particular, colorectal.
However, exceeding the required dose, on the contrary, contributes to the growth of cancer cells.
Professor of the University of Alabama in Birmingham, nutritionist Beth Kitchin advises to monitor the amount of folic acid consumed during the day.
The optimal dose is 400 micrograms per day.
The threat of cancer increases only if there is a significant deviation from this figure in a greater or lesser direction.
Kitchin recommends not taking vitamin B9 in tablets without a doctor's recommendation, be sure to monitor the dosage and avoid milk flakes and other foods that contain folic acid.
Earlier, nutrition consultant Rachel Fine called folic acid a substance that slows down aging.
Since it is, among other things, contained in avocados, Fine recommended that men after 50 years eat this fruit more often.
In the UK, by April, about 75 thousand people may die due to the omicron strain
Forecasts of British scientists show that due to the spread of the omicron strain of coronavirus, up to 75 thousand people may die in England in the next five months, if restrictive measures are not tightened in winter.
This was reported by The Guardian newspaper with reference to a study by experts from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine (LSHTM), TASS reports.
According to the most optimistic forecast of specialists who are part of the scientific advisory group on emergency situations under the British Cabinet of Ministers, by April 2022, at least 25 thousand deaths due to the omicron strain will be recorded in the country, and about 175 thousand patients will be hospitalized.
At the peak of the disease, hospitals will receive more than 2,000 infected people daily.
"Serious measures to combat coronavirus may be required to prevent the National Health Service from being overwhelmed if the omicrone strain is more contagious than the delta variant, and existing vaccines cannot exclude infection," said mathematician Rosanna Barnard of LSHTM.
Earlier, the UK Health Safety Agency informed that if the rate of spread of the omicrone strain remains at the current level, then by the end of the year about 1 million cases of infection will be detected in the country.
At the same time, by mid-December, the omicron strain may become dominant in the United Kingdom.
At the moment, 1,898 cases of infection with the omicron strain of coronavirus have been detected in the UK, of which 633 have been detected over the past 24 hours.
At the same time, on December 9, the head of the British Ministry of Health Sajid Javid pointed out that in reality this figure could already reach 10,000 cases.

Demand for superyachts grew by a quarter in the world
The construction of superyachts this year and orders for next year are breaking all records in the world, despite calls to reduce the hydrocarbon footprint and the fight against climate change.
In the world register of ships, the number of ordered yachts amounted to 1,200 units - a quarter more than last year.
In the era of fighting the effects of climate change to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, it is difficult to imagine that the number of people who have the desire and money for a floating fortress for $50 million pounds and above will not decrease, writes The Guardian.
However, they are becoming more and more.
This year, 25% more vessels were ordered than in the previous year.
Brokers say that there has been no such excitement in the market for 20 years.
The first reason is that many who can afford a yacht are afraid of infection on land and prefer to hide from the pandemic on board their own ship.
The second reason is also related to the coronavirus.
If earlier all these people went to the office and met with business partners in person, now the vast majority of them work remotely, and negotiations are conducted on the zoom.
Broker Will Christie told the newspaper that shipyards are taking orders for new yachts for 2025 and later.
This means that customers are willing to pay more, if only their yacht was ready at least a year or two earlier.
"People just crave freedom, and the super-rich could afford it," he says.
In Western society, many criticize this behavior of the rich and call it decadent.
The rich, sociologists say, do not want to understand that in times of hardship, traveling into space, living on yachts or flying on their own airplanes cause irritation in society, because the elite do not want to share responsibility for climate change with the rest of humanity.
Economists call on governments to act and propose new taxes and rules for the super-rich, although they understand that with such mobility of money, it will be extremely difficult to implement.
Meanwhile, only the number of super-yachts ordered is impressive, but also their characteristics.
Of the 1,200 vessels, 27 have a stern length above 100 meters.
Norwegian billionaire Rekke is building a yacht REV Ocean with a length of 183 meters.
After launching it will be the largest yacht in the world.
The yacht has a "lunar pool," as well as a submarine designed to study the deep sea.
On existing super-yachts, helicopter platforms, open-air cinemas have become common, and on some of them, such as on the wrestler McGregor's yacht, a platform for martial arts. Richard Wilk, professor of economic anthropology at the American University in Indiana, says that compared to the total number of greenhouse gas selections, the carbon footprint produced by the super-rich is insignificant.
But it has symbolic significance, given that there are just over 2,000 multi-billionaires in the world.
This is just another example of overconsumption of a very small group of people.
Scientists have found that the emission footprint of billionaires is thousands of times larger than that of the average inhabitant of the planet.
If one person produces an average of 5 tons of CO2 per year, then the planet's largest pollutant Roman Abramovich is responsible for 33.9 tons of greenhouse gases that entered the atmosphere in 2018.
At the same time, two-thirds of the emission footprint fell on his yacht Eclipse, 162.5 meters long.
Even if the owner is not on board the yacht, the crew continues to poison the planet.

A dangerous weekly dose of alcohol was determined, leading to the development of bowel cancer
American scientists have determined how much alcoholic beverages per week increases the risk of cancer.
The Daily Express writes about this.
Experts concluded that the use of four or more servings of alcoholic beverages per week is associated with an increased risk of developing oncology.
At the same time, the likelihood of developing the disease increases with the increase in the amount of alcohol consumed.
Moreover, moderately drunk men have a higher risk of bowel cancer than women.
Scientists cannot determine the exact reason for the development of this type of oncology, noting only that certain factors lead to a process harmful to the body.

Dogs can understand words and phrases at the level of a two-year-old child
Many, or rather all dog lovers are sure that these creatures are very smart.
But even they do not know how four-legged pets are actually developed.
Over the years, biologists have conducted various experiments to find out for sure how the intelligence of animals is developed.
Although the dog's vocabulary is not as extensive as human, a new study proves that a dog can consistently respond to 89 words or phrases.
The works of scientists were published in the publication Sciencealert.
Dogs can not play chess or write poetry, do not understand anything in politics, economics and art, yet they often manage to fool their owners.
Representatives of some breeds, experts say, show the best results in understanding the words of the human language, but statistical data are not enough for accurate conclusions.
So, some breeds are traditionally considered dog geniuses - for example, Labradors.
Scientists have concluded that dogs are capable of logical thinking, and the ability to learn is not inferior to a two-year-old child.

In Ukraine, the United States and Russia prepared for bargaining
The United States and Russia will "bargain" over Ukraine's accession to NATO, said analyst Alexander Kochetkov in his article for Glavred.
In his opinion, Washington and Moscow plan to continue negotiations in the near future on the guarantees of the United States that Ukraine will not join the North Atlantic Alliance, despite the words of the American leader Joe Biden about the right of countries to "join anywhere."
If you are offered something obviously unacceptable, well, for example, to sell a close relative into sexual slavery, you will not bargain, but simply send the offeror.
And in relation to Ukraine, bargaining is planned, "the analyst wrote.

China stimulates development of railway transport industry
Advanced Chinese technologies attracted the attention of companies from the United States, Germany, France and other countries at the China International Rail Transport and Equipment Manufacturing Exhibition 2021, held in Zhuzhou, Hunan Province /Central China/.
The main technologies developed by CRRC Zhuzhou Locomotive Co. Ltd. allow trains to automatically detect and diagnose technical malfunctions, said company representative Hou Zhaowen.
High-speed trains running on the China-Laos railway line, which was put into operation earlier this month, are already equipped with these technologies, which will ensure increased reliability and efficiency of rolling stock.
Over the past six months, China has significantly increased exports of railway vehicles and many countries in Asia and Europe are witnessing "Chinese speed."
In May of this year, the first two-decker high-speed electric trains developed in China, intended for export to Europe, were launched from the production line of CRRC Zhuzhou Locomotive Co., Ltd.
With a maximum operating speed of 200 kilometers per hour, these trains will run on the railways of Austria, Germany, Hungary and other European countries.
In November, the trial operation of the metro train developed by the above-mentioned company for Turkey began.
The train will move along the metro line connecting the center of Istanbul with the city airport.
Traffic on this metro line will be opened next year.
It will be the fastest metro line in Turkey at a speed of 120 kilometers per hour.
"China's railway equipment industry is one of the industries with the highest level of innovation and the strongest international innovation competitiveness," said Feng Yaoxiang, head of the trade and investment department of the China Committee for the Promotion of International Trade.
"This industry is the main competitive advantage of Chinese production of high-end equipment in the global market," Feng Yaoxiang said.
After more than 60 years of hard work, having conducted a number of independent research and development, China has created an advanced system for the production of equipment for railway transport, with a full range of auxiliary means and large-scale production activities.
According to Feng Yaoxiang, the country ranks first in terms of railway electrification and operational mileage on high-speed and urban railways.
Biologist lists early signs of dementia
Candidate of Biological Sciences Semyon Golosheykin in an interview with Sputnik radio listed early signs of dementia.
According to him, signs of future dementia can be forgetfulness, as well as a number of moderate cognitive impairments, such as inability to concentrate, planning, and a decrease in the level of abstract thinking.
Currently, there is a discussion that hearing loss can be both an early manifestation of Alzheimer's disease and one of the risk factors for its occurrence, the specialist said.
Golosheykin emphasized that the causes of dementia can be neurodegenerative disorders, head injuries, some infections, metabolic disorders, lack of certain vitamins.
He added that Alzheimer's disease and atherosclerosis of the cerebral vessels are the most common causes of this syndrome.
The biologist noted that today doctors do not know effective ways to treat dementia.
Therefore, it is necessary to start its prevention in time.
According to him, learning foreign languages and active communication will help reduce the risk of developing dementia.
WHO also recommends maintaining a moderate level of physical activity, regularly training cognitive skills through games and hobbies that require intensive involvement of memory and logic of thinking
"There are recommendations for the use of various dietary supplements, but their effectiveness and feasibility are still being discussed in the scientific community," Golosheykin said.
"The World Health Organization recommends maintaining a moderate level of physical activity, regular training of cognitive skills and abilities through games and hobbies that require intensive involvement of memory and logic of thinking," Golosheykin said.
Earlier, a charity for dementia research in the UK said that the disease is increasingly affecting people aged 40 years.
Doctors named the early symptoms of Alzheimer's disease.
The first alarming sign can be considered problems with vision, due to which the patient acquires difficulties in recognizing objects.
Another sign of developing dementia experts called aphasia - a condition when a person cannot find the right words to convey what he wants to say.
Neurologist demanded to send Saakashvili for treatment abroad
Former Georgian President Mikheil Saakashvili needs psychonervous treatment and rehabilitation abroad, neurologist Otar Toidze, who is a member of the medical council established under the Georgian Ombudsman, told journalists.
His [Saakashvili's] neurological status is leading in his disease.
Stable problems are problems with movement, coordination, variability of character, "the expert said, noting that this does not go beyond the regulatory framework and now the ex-president should be sent for special rehabilitation.
"We call this neurorehabilitation and psychonervous rehabilitation, the possibility of which we have not found in Georgia," Toidze said, demanding that Saakashvili be treated in a special institution, which does not exist in Georgia.
On the evening of December 7, Saakashvili began sabotaging medical care after prison officers subjected him to disciplinary punishment.
The Georgian politician quickly managed to abolish the punishment and restore his former rights.

Protests against COVID passports took place in Spain
Protests were held in the Spanish cities of Barcelona and Valencia against the mandatory certificate of vaccination against COVID-19, Europa Press reports.
In the Catalan capital, the number of participants in the action was approximately 3,000 people.
In Barcelona, COVID passports have become mandatory for going to bars, restaurants, gyms, nursing homes and night entertainment venues.
Many demonstrators came to the action without masks.
With slogans on their posters, they accused the state of totalitarianism and called for respect for the choice of citizens.
In Valencia, vaccination passports will also be required to enter entertainment venues and restaurants with a capacity of more than 50 people.
Protesters in this city declared a medical dictatorship, and vaccination was called an experiment.
In Spain, since the beginning of the pandemic, more than 5.2 million cases of coronavirus infection have been detected, more than 88 thousand patients have died.
In Russia, it is also planned to introduce restrictions for the unvaccinated.
The government submitted bills on a unified system of QR codes to the State Duma on November 12.
It is assumed that Russians will be able to visit places of mass events, cultural institutions, catering and retail facilities with the presentation of either a certificate of vaccination or a disease, or a medical evacuation from vaccination.
The same rules will be established for travel by train and airplane.

Steep climb: how the Chinese become skiers
The Olympics should attract millions of people to the slopes and help create international resorts in the country
China hopes that the Olympics will not only attract 300 million citizens to winter sports, which will collect the 1 trillion yuan designated by President Xi Jinping, but also contribute to the economic development of backward remote provinces.
The Taiwu ski resort in Zhangjiakou, located near the site of the Winter Olympic Games, is becoming increasingly popular with the Chinese.
In addition to the construction of infrastructure, landscaping works are also being carried out in the region: workers are planting trees.
There are more than 700 ski resorts in the country, but only 20 of them are large enough to host international competitions.
In many regions of China, where resorts are located, including in Zhangjiakou, there are problems with snow.
The main task for the long term is to provide a comfortable and interesting holiday in Chinese resorts, so that all newcomers become regulars.
However, this is still a long way off.
Games adviser Justin Downs says that since his last visit in 2007, the Chinese ski industry has changed beyond recognition.
Every winter, more and more Chinese go to the slopes.
Fiona, a snowboarder from Beijing, is one of them.
Despite major changes, it will take many more years to create a ski culture here, Downs said.
Many resorts are located in agricultural and mining areas.
These regions have yet to actively develop and create the necessary infrastructure for recreation.
The 70-year-old Gao Makong lives in Chunli, near the venues of the Winter Olympics.
He notes that in recent years there has been a boom in winter sports tourism.
Two years ago, a high-speed railway was built from Beijing to Chunli, now none of the locals suffer without work.
More and more shops selling clothing and equipment for winter sports are opening in the country.
On the slopes open catering points with dishes of national cuisine.
Taiwu now even has a COVID-19 testing station.
China is striving to create a thriving winter sports industry, its athletes should become leaders of the largest international competitions, and resorts and equipment should reach the world level.
More than 500 million people in the world may face extreme poverty due to the pandemic, the WHO said
More than 500 million people in the world could be plunged into extreme poverty due to the coronavirus pandemic, which slowed down the progress of humanity in the issue of universal access to health services, the World Health Organization (WHO) and the World Bank (WB) said.
On the occasion of the International Day for Universal Health Coverage on December 12, WHO and WB published two complementary reports.
In them, they stated that the pandemic led to failures in the provision of medical services, caused excessive stress in health care systems.
In this regard, for the first time in 10 years, immunization coverage has decreased, and mortality from tuberculosis and malaria has increased.
The WHO and the WB stressed that the pandemic caused "the worst economic crisis since the 1930s, so it became more difficult for people to pay for treatment."
This situation pushes more than 500 million people "into extreme poverty, because they have to pay for these services out of pocket."
In October, UN Secretary General António Guterres said that the coronavirus pandemic has plunged more than 100 million people into poverty, more than four billion people have practically no social support.

Reuters: Taiwan minister cut off from broadcast at "Summit for Democracy" at the request of the White House
Taiwan's digital minister Audrey Tan's speech at a panel discussion during the US-sponsored "Summit for Democracy" was put into video-free mode, according to a recording of the summit on YouTube.
Reuters, citing sources, claims that the picture was turned off at the request of the White House.
According to them, the reason was the map on which Taiwan was highlighted in a separate color from the PRC, which considers the island its territory.
The map shown by Ms. Tan was compiled by the South African non-governmental organization CIVICUS and ranked the countries of the world by the degree of civil rights.
Taiwan was highlighted in green as "free," and China, North Korea, Laos and Vietnam in red as "closed."
After the minister showed the map, the picture on her side was replaced with a screenshot with a note that the opinions of the participants in the discussion "do not necessarily express the position of the US government."
The PRC was not invited to the "Summit for Democracy."
Reuters sources note that the map shown by the Taiwanese minister could run counter to the "one China" policy pursued by Washington.
One of the agency's sources said that after showing the map, the US National Security Council angrily contacted the State Department, accusing it of showing Taiwan as a separate country.
The "Summit for Democracy" organized by Washington was held from 9 to 10 December with the participation of representatives of 110 countries and territories, as well as civil associations and charitable organizations.
Russia was not invited to the summit.
During the "zero day" of the summit, Nobel Peace Prize laureate, editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta Dmitry Muratov called for the creation of an international fund through which money obtained through corruption would be given to charity.
Earlier today, Deputy Secretary of the Security Council of the Russian Federation Yuri Averyanov said that the summit carried an "anti-Russian and anti-Chinese charge."

The New Shepard spacecraft with six tourists on board made a suborbital flight
Blue Origin's New Shepard spacecraft with six tourists on board made a suborbital flight on Saturday, December 11.
The journey, broadcast on the company's website, lasted a total of more than ten minutes, after which the capsule with passengers descended to Earth, TASS reported.
The launch of the launch vehicle was carried out from the cosmodrome near the American city of Van Horn (Texas).
The ship rose to a height of just over 100 km, space tourists were in a state of weightlessness.
The carrier rocket itself landed on the site of the cosmodrome.
On July 20, Blue Origin successfully carried out the first suborbital flight of the New Shepard with passengers on board.

China strengthens the prevention and control of the COVID-19 epidemic in cities where land checkpoints are located
The joint prevention and control mechanism of the State Council of the People's Republic of China issued a circular ordering to strengthen the prevention and control of the COVID-19 epidemic in cities where land checkpoints are located, in order to further prevent the import of infection from abroad.
According to the circular, people leaving these cities must provide a negative COVID-19 nucleic acid test result received within 48 hours before departure.
Those who come to cities where land checkpoints are located must take at least one COVID-19 nucleic acid test upon arrival.
The document states that these requirements will be effective from the day when the relevant administrative units of the provincial level identify and publish the zones of these cities, until March 15, 2022.
In addition, it is noted that cities where land checkpoints are located and that meet certain conditions may consider creating buffer zones for the prevention and control of the COVID-19 epidemic within their jurisdiction.

The Foreign Ministry told about the "sad conclusion" in relations between Russia and the United States
Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov in an interview with Izvestia assessed the prospects of relations between Moscow and Washington.
He noted that the long path of cooperation led to sad conclusions, and the problems between the two countries did not begin yesterday.
There is one-sided negative predictability, but in terms of some prospect of improving relations, everything is completely unpredictable.
This is a sad conclusion after a long journey that we have gone through with the current administration, Trump, and Obama.
The problems did not start yesterday, "the diplomat said.
According to Ryabkov, the problem is connected with the desire of the United States to impose approaches on Russia on a variety of issues.
The deputy foreign minister added that he would not risk giving optimistic forecasts about the prospects for improving relations and would not expect a change in Washington's position.
He explained that with the exception of such areas as strategic stability and cyber security, there is no progress.
At the same time, Russia calls on the United States to take a responsible approach to international security issues and hopes that the signals will be heard, and the Americans will listen to the arguments of common sense.
Earlier, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov at a meeting with US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken said that Moscow is ready to restore dialogue with the United States.
The virologist warned about the danger of vaccination with a nasal drug for COVID outside hospitals
Those vaccinated with the nasal vaccine against COVID-19 may have allergies and need medical help, so the first points for vaccination with this drug should not be organized at airports and shopping centers.
This was reported by TASS virologist, corresponding member of the Russian Academy of Sciences, head of the laboratory of bionanotechnology, microbiology and virology of the Novosibirsk State University Sergey Netesov.
It is easier to organize nasal vaccine vaccination points in airports and shopping centers, but I would do it at first only in medical institutions.
The fact is that there is a possibility of an allergic reaction to such a vaccine, it is small, but it is desirable that the person then sit next to the doctor's office.
Doctors have special sets of antiallergic drugs that act literally in a minute or two, which is sometimes very necessary, "Netesov said.
According to the virologist, it will be possible to think about vaccination in shopping centers when experience in using the drug is accumulated.
He also stressed that when using the nasal vaccine, it is important that it gets on the mucous membrane in the nasal cavity.
At the same time, there is a possibility that the vaccine will not reach its destination if the person vaccinated with a stuffy nose swollen after injection.

Everything is very simple!

Each segment is numbered so as not to get lost in the colors.

But this picture was not painted by some artist.
You drew it yourself.

Serbia produces 2 million doses of Sputnik V vaccine
The Sputnik V vaccine is the most popular in Serbia.
Serbia has produced about 2 million doses of the Russian Sputnik V vaccine, Minister of Innovation and Technological Development Nenad Popovic told TASS.
"The Torlak State Institute has so far produced about 2 million doses of Sputnik V vaccine, and we expect that at least 4 million of them will be produced in the coming period," Popovich stated.
According to him, the Russian vaccine is the most popular among the Serbs.
In this regard, the republic plans to purchase an additional million doses of vaccine from Russia.
The Minister of Innovation and Technological Development of Serbia also expressed interest in the production of the nasal vaccine Sputnik V and the drug Sputnik Light on the territory of the state.
Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin said that the Russian Federation has delivered almost two million doses of the domestic Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine to Serbia.

Mattress Benartti Prime Orto S1000 145x190
Mattress Prime Orto S1000 with different sides of stiffness, total mattress height 22 cm.
The maximum permissible load per bed is up to 150 kg.
The basis of the mattress is an independent spring block "S1000" (1000 springs per bed).
Each spring is located in a separate fabric pocket, which allows the springs to correctly distribute the load of the body.
For additional protection of the spring block, an insulation layer of felt has been added, separating the mattress and spring fillers.
On one side of the mattress is a layer of coconut coir 3 cm high, which gives additional rigidity and durability to the mattress.
On the opposite side of the mattress added a layer of coconut coir 3 cm and natural latex 1 cm.
Natural latex has an anatomical effect and wear-resistant properties.
The mattress cover is made of cotton jacquard, quilted on environmentally friendly material Hollcon.
The fabric is treated with a special antibacterial impregnation Sanitized (Sweden).
Impregnation ensures the complete destruction of mold fungi, prevents the development of microorganisms, dust mites and microbes.
The mattress is equipped with four comfortable handles for turning over, as well as aerators for additional ventilation of the mattress layers.
The mattress along the perimeter is additionally reinforced with a frame made of artificial latex, which significantly increases its service life.

In the UK, 1239 cases of omicron strain of coronavirus were recorded per day - RT in Russian
During the day, 1239 cases of infection with the new omicron strain of coronavirus were detected in the UK.
Sky News reports this.
In particular, 1,196 new cases of the omicron strain were recorded in England, 38 people fell ill with a new type of infection in Scotland and five in Northern Ireland.
The total number of COVID-19 cases from the new strain in the UK has reached 3137 people.
Earlier, scientists from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine calculated in a pessimistic forecast that 75 thousand people could die in England by April due to an outbreak of coronavirus caused by the omicron strain.

New Caledonians rejected the idea of independence from France
According to the final results of the third referendum on the independence of New Caledonia, the vast majority of participants refused to leave France.
This was reported on December 12 by the French TV channel BFM.TV.
96.5% of voters were against independence.
3.51% of the inhabitants of the archipelago in the South Pacific supported independence from France.
The results of 2.99% of ballots were canceled.
The level of voting on that day was very low: about 55% of the inhabitants of the archipelago came to the polling stations.
According to experts, the low turnout is due to calls by separatists to refuse to participate in the referendum because of the coronavirus.
Paris refused to postpone the referendum.
In October 2020, New Caledonians voted in a referendum against independence from France.
In 2018, a referendum on independence was already held in the region.
Most residents supported the location of the archipelago as part of France.
New Caledonia is located almost 20 thousand kilometers from mainland France.
In 1853, France declared New Caledonia its possession.
About 270 thousand people live in the archipelago, the territory is endowed with a special administrative-territorial status.
There is a 1998 agreement between Paris and the administration of New Caledonia, according to which the region can organize a vote on its independence twice with a difference of two years.

The Udmurts are beautiful, hard-working people, they have preserved their language, they live in friendship with the Tatars, they know 3-4 languages.

WHO preliminary considers "omicron" less dangerous than "delta"
The World Health Organization (WHO) preliminary believes that "omicron" is less dangerous than the delta strain of coronavirus.
At the same time, there is evidence of a decrease in the effectiveness of vaccines with a new variant of COVID-19.
As of December 9, omicron is registered in 63 countries.
"Preliminary data and a significantly changed antigenic protein profile of the omicron strain suggest a decrease in the effectiveness of the vaccine against infection and transmission of the variant.
According to preliminary findings from South Africa, it is assumed that it ("severity of the disease" - ed.) may be less severe than in the "delta," "the WHO technical report says.
The organization notes that so far all registered cases of infection with "omicron" in the EU are easy or asymptomatic.
At the same time, the new strain, according to preliminary data, spreads faster than the "delta."
Two cases of infection with the omicron strain have been registered in Russia.
They "were previously immunized," the Gamalei Center reported.
The head of Rospotrebnadzor, Anna Popova, stated that so far there is no reliable data that the new version of the coronavirus is less dangerous than the rest.

Four scenarios for Zelensky were named in Ukraine
Ex-deputy of the Verkhovna Rada Vadim Denisenko listed four options for the development of events for the President of Ukraine Vladimir Zelensky in 2022.
In his opinion, the head of state may be left without the support of the West, and may also compromise on the Donbas.
On Sunday, December 12, Denisenko told about this in a publication on the Glavred portal.
The first option, which Denisenko called a "perfect storm," assumes that key Western countries will stop supporting Ukraine, reaching an agreement on the country's future without its participation.
Such a development will contribute to the deep crisis that Kiev may face in 2023.
"In parallel, there is a decrease in prices for key goods that we traditionally export <... > internal protests and confrontation between the authorities and key FPGs (financial and industrial groups. - Ed.)," the ex-parliamentary added.
According to Denisenko, there is another scenario for the development of the situation - "war against all."
This forecast will come true in the event of high turbulence in world politics, in which the Ukrainian authorities will face a number of problems.
Because of this state of affairs, the leadership of Ukraine can make compromises on the Donbas, as a result of which a confrontation within the country is possible.
At the end of summer, Zelensky's position will weaken, the probability of such a situation, according to the former MP, is up to 50-55%.
The third option for the development of the situation in Ukrainian politics is a confrontation between the population groups that disagree with Zelensky and the president, which is why the seizure of control over the power bloc and the implementation of "populist initiatives" are likely.
In the course of such a variant of the crisis, Zelensky will begin "reformatting the power," Denisenko added.
Another scenario is the transformation of Zelensky into the "father of the nation."
Some event can lead to this, which will be a strong shock to society.
"The event should be large enough to cause a reaction from external partners and lead to an increase in support for Ukraine," Denisenko said.
Such a variant of the development of the situation is possible as a result of a natural disaster, a man-made disaster or aggressive actions of Russia, the ex-deputy believes.
At this, the Russian side has repeatedly rejected any possibility of an "attack" on Ukraine.
Moscow noted that it is the Ukrainian authorities, NATO and the United States that are increasing military activity at the Russian borders.
Earlier, on November 11, a survey by the sociological group "Rating" showed that the rating of the Ukrainian president fell to record lows, amounting to 19.3%.
This is the lowest figure since his election as head of state.
Analysts predicted a situation in which in the case of the next presidential elections in Ukraine, only 21.8% would vote for Zelensky, while for the country's ex-president Petro Poroshenko - 14.5%.
At the same time, only 19.3% of all respondents expressed support for the president.

The product of the brand "Butison" from the series "Sens" is intended for the healthy sleep of people suffering from diseases of the joints and vascular system.
The design provides a uniform distribution of the load on the surface and a pronounced comfortable effect.
The basis of the mattress Butison Sens Hard S600 mini Sint XL independent spring block S600 mini with reduced spring height.
Beautyson uses spunbond, coconut coir and polyurethane foam as internal fillers.
Spunbond serves as an intermediate insulating layer between soft materials and springs.

The poet arrested for the action on Red Square: "For the quote of Yevtushenko, 10 days are given, here it is, the power of poetry!"
At the beginning of the week, 21-year-old poet Alexander Volchenkov was arrested for ten days.
A student of the Higher School of Economics was detained on Red Square with a poster on which was written the hashtag #poet of Russia.
This quote belongs to the writer Yevgeny Yevtushenko.
A protocol was drawn up against Alexander under an administrative article on repeated violation of the procedure for holding a public action.
The first time he was detained on January 23 on Pushkin Square, at a rally in support of Alexei Navalny.
"The goal was to draw attention to poetry in general, now the interest in it, unfortunately, is lost, to the decline of the common culture in Russia and also a small hope to inspire unknown poets to write their poems on the Internet under this hashtag," explains Alexander.
We contacted the young poet to find out the circumstances of the detention and reveal the message of his message in more detail.
How did the police treat you during the arrest this time and earlier?
What did the department ask, how did they comment on your action?
This time, the employees were more correct, the detention was maximum, polite, no matter how ridiculous it sounded in some context of the word.
On Pushkinskaya riot policemen took and took hard.
They asked standardly about the motives.
When they heard, in principle, they looked if not approvingly, then understandingly.
With the exception of the monkey being blown on all 4 sides, everything was extremely correct, but I knew what I was going for.
And if after the action, at least a few people begin to write their poems under this hashtag, I will not spend these 10 days in vain.

Researchers told how potatoes help in the fight against age-related disorders
The study showed that potatoes are rich in vitamins and trace elements that help improve blood circulation and reduce cholesterol.
The root contains B vitamins, vitamin C, phosphorus, potassium, magnesium, riboflavin, folic and pantothenic acid.
All these elements help the body's systems to function.
In addition, potatoes help in the fight against age-related disorders.
Due to the high content of fiber, it is useful for the gastrointestinal tract, and with regular use can also help in the prevention of hypertension and atherosclerosis.
However, for the greatest benefit, it is better to stew or cook the root, rather than fry in oil.
Earlier, The Daily Express warned that potatoes can be dangerous for diabetics, like other foods with a high glycemic index.
These are carbohydrate-containing foods that quickly break down into sugars, such as sugar, sweet soft drinks, white rice, and white bread.
In early December, the Kommersant newspaper warned of a possible shortage of Russian table potatoes, noting a reduction in their production in private farms and an increase in processing capacity.
According to market participants, the shortage of products at the moment can only replace imports.
Lostfilm, lordfilm and other pirates will be removed from the issue of Yandex
Candidates for departure
In 2015, rights holders from the RAEC/Media cluster compiled a list of the 100 largest pirate sites on Runet and most of them ceased to exist, says Karen Kazaryan, general director of the Internet Research Institute.
But some - Kinogo, Lostfilm, Filmix - still managed to survive thanks to, among other things, regular change of domain name, he adds.
For example, on Lostfilm, which is available in the search results of both Yandex and Google, you can see pirated copies of the Netflix series "The Squid Game" and "Tenderness" directed by Anna Melikyan - the original series of Russia's largest video service ivi (included in AIV).
On Kinogo, which is also available in search engines, you can see the animated novelty "Encanto," but judging by the quality of the video, this is the so-called screen (a pirated copy of the film shot in a cinema).
On Filmix, which can also be found through search engines, the series "Univer. 10 years later" of the TNT channel (part of Gazprom-media) is available.

Mattress Dimax Micro Ultimate, size 160x190
Orthopedic spring mattress Micro Ultimate.
The model is convenient in that it has two different softness surfaces of high rigidity and slightly more than average.
The composition of the product includes only high-quality and premium fillers that have proven themselves exclusively from the best side.
Springs: in the center of the model there is a block of independent springs "micropackage."
This means that there are 2000 spirals per bed, which work completely autonomously.
It is their functioning that gives a unique point adjustment.
"Micropackage" is the highest frequency of all the variety of spring blocks "Dimax," therefore it has a pronounced orthopedic effect and is considered premium.
Fillers: combinations of coir and natural latex layers are installed on top and bottom of the springs.
The only difference is the order of the plates.
If one surface has latex, then the other has coconut coir.
Such a tandem of fillers has long carried the status of a classic, since it gives the mattress not only orthopedic, but also anatomical properties.
If the coir provides the correct support for the back, then latex gives the surface adaptation to the human body.
Case: The model comes in a quilted knitted Aloe Vera case.
At the request of the client, it can be made both removable and stationary.
The total height of the product is 27 cm, the recommended load on the bed is 170 kg.
Guarantee and safety: The warranty period is 3 years.
The mattress has received all the necessary certificates and documents that confirm its complete safety and reliability in operation.
Orthopedic foam, which is used in the mattress, has a certificate CertiPUR.
Estonian scientists will search for life on Venus
The Massachusetts Institute of Technology, in cooperation with the Tartu Observatory and other research institutions and companies, is preparing three space missions to Venus to search for signs of life in the atmosphere, the Current Camera reported on Sunday.
The goal of the missions starting in five years is to assess the habitability of the clouds of Venus, and then search for life there.
For the project, Tartu scientists proposed tools for measuring the acidity and oxygen content in the clouds of Venus.
Until now, it has been assumed that the clouds of Venus, the planet closest to Earth, are too acidic for life to exist there, but it is likely that Venus was originally a terrestrial planet.
During the third mission, a sample from Venus should arrive.
Suppose that if we find life there, the main question will be whether it is similar to the earthly or different.
If it is very similar, it will be obvious that earthly life did not begin on Earth.
If it is different, then it may be more likely that life originated on Earth, "said Mihkel Pajusalu, head of the Estonian team of the Venus Life Finder project.

Metauniverses will change Russian business
The topic of metauniverses became popular this fall, when Mark Zuckerberg announced the transformation of Facebook into Meta.
This event was an important signal for the market: the largest player confirmed the development of a new format of digital interaction between people.
This means that business in Russia, as well as around the world, will invest in the creation of its own metauniverses and their subsequent monetization.
Metauniverses should be considered as a continuation of objectively existing trends.
On the one hand, the trend to create remote interactions in a pandemic, because people are tired of separation and restrictions.
On the other hand, it is a consequence of the desire of business to develop ecosystems and adapt operating models for them.
With the third - they are a logical continuation of the trend of digitalization of assets, when any rights, securities, works of art and even money are transferred to digital format.

The British economist could not give a forecast for 2022
British economist Jim O'Neill could not give a forecast for 2022, because, in his opinion, such attempts would fail.
He wrote about this in an article for Project Syndicate.
The expert believes that the next year will be full of unpredictability and any trend can change the turnover.
The most important factor remains the coronavirus pandemic, and inflation is in second place, he believes.
O'Neill also admitted that he does not know whether the increase in prices for goods is temporary or not.
As the expert pointed out, even before the pandemic, it was clear that "the world of endless generosity of central banks had already outlived itself" and it was time to return to relations where interest rates, taking into account inflation, would correlate with the expected GDP growth rate.
O'Neill noted that against the backdrop of the pandemic, the continuation of ultra-soft economic policy may, according to some experts, lead to a new surge in inflation.
In addition, attention should be paid to the issue of productivity growth, as well as the increase in poverty and climate change, O'Neill concluded.
Earlier, the head of the global research department of Opening Investments, Mikhail Shulgin, said that positive expectations for the dollar exchange rate for 2022 remain, while the growth potential will be less significant.
Among the risks to the dollar exchange rate, Shulgin named the Fed's monetary policy, the dynamics of oil prices and concerns against the backdrop of the coronavirus pandemic.
