Indian Prime Minister's Twitter hacked
Hackers broke into the Twitter account of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
The attackers managed to publish a fake message.
It was reported that India had allegedly recognized Bitcoin as legal tender, and that the country had already purchased the cryptocurrency.
Modi's office asked that the new reports be ignored.
Representatives of the prime minister said that Twitter reacted quickly - they restored access to the account.
The page of the Prime Minister of India was already hacked in 2020 and called for donations to the fund with the help of cryptocurrency.
In the referendum in New Caledonia, the majority voted against independence
In New Caledonia, the third referendum, held on December 12, ended with the same result as the previous two.
According to the first partial results announced on Sunday, December 12, at noon, the majority of New Caledonians voted during the referendum against the independence of their territory.
At the same time, the level of participation in this third vote was significantly lower than in the previous two.
According to the preliminary results published by the local authorities, 3.51% (2,755 people) voted for the independence of New Caledonia from France, while 96.49% (75,762) voted against.
Turnout was 43.90%, with more than 80,000 New Caledonians voting in total.
As Agence France-Presse comments on these interim results, "the outcome of these elections left no room for doubt," as supporters of independence called on voters not to participate in the vote.
Being the initiators of the referendum, they opposed its holding on December 12, believing that the new outbreak of the COVID-19 epidemic in the archipelago prevents a full and "honest" election campaign.
Thus, this non-participation opened the way to the third victory of the supporters of French New Caledonia, after the referendums held in November 2018 and in October 2020.
In 2018, 56.7% of residents voted against independence, in 2020 - 53.3%.
As the separatists stated, they do not recognize the results of the last vote and will challenge them in the UN.
As reported on Sunday, December 12, in the Elysee Palace, French President Emmanuel Macron is to speak on the results of this referendum.
The topic of New Caledonia's independence has in many ways enlivened the final weeks of the French presidential campaign.
Several presidential candidates have spoken out in favour of the territory remaining part of France, as it is "the last region of presence of the European Union in the Pacific Ocean."
"New Caledonia must remain French," Eric Zemmour has repeatedly said.
The same statement was made by the Republican candidate Valerie Pecresse, who at the end of October published a column in Le Figaro, calling on the Caledonians to remain French.
For his part, Emmanuel Macron announced in May 2018 that he would not take a position "because it is not his responsibility."
However, the president added: "France would be less beautiful without New Caledonia."
Prime Minister Jean Castex, for his part, expressed "a strong desire that the choice of the Caledonians is the choice of France."

The world's first drone with a laser weapon was tested in Turkey
The world's first drone with a laser weapon has been successfully tested in Turkey.
The Eren UAV was tested at a distance of 100 to 500 m, reports MIR24.
The device is capable of neutralizing explosive objects at a distance using a laser.
The maximum flight altitude of the novelty reaches 3 thousand meters.
After passing the appropriate tests, the UAV should enter service with the Turkish military, which will use it to destroy explosive devices without the involvement of sappers.
The agency emphasizes that Turkey is among six countries in the world capable of developing and producing its own drones.

WSJ readers criticize article on Russia-U.S. relations
Readers of The Wall Street Journal criticized an article by Professor Christopher Hartwell, in which he described his vision of relations between Russia and the United States.
The author of the material expressed concern that the West is allegedly sacrificing Ukraine to Russia.
In his article, he convinces readers of the danger that comes from Moscow, and made a number of offensive statements about Russian President Vladimir Putin.
In the end, Hartwell called on Western countries to "present a united front against Russia."
WSJ readers expressed their disagreement with the position of the American professor.
"There is quite a lot of false information in this article," RIA Novosti quotes one reader's comment.
"Europe is not ours to "lose," and Ukraine is not our land.
The United States and NATO allies will never enter into a nuclear war with Russia for the sake of Ukraine," said another.

The NORES 2085/EL lamp consists of a metal base and a plastic diffuser.
The material of the diffuser is a high-quality matte white acrylic, which provides the lamp with uniform diffusion and good light transmission.
The shape of the lampshade: square, in the form of a relief ornament with a geometric pattern, decorated with transparent dots, giving the switched-on lamp a beautiful effect of "star flicker" and transfusion.
The degree of protection IP43 allows the lamp to be used in certain areas of wet rooms.
The kit includes a replaceable LED module with lenses, with a power of 72 W, which corresponds to a 520 W incandescent lamp.
As well as the remote control, which is used to smoothly change the color temperature of 3000-6000K, change the brightness, switch to the warm/white/cold/night light switching mode.

Earthquake of magnitude 5.2 occurred near the Kuril Islands
An earthquake of magnitude 5.2 occurred near the Kuril island of Shikotan.
It is noted that the epicenter of the earthquake was located 231.8 km north-east of the city of Severo-Kurilsk.
The source lay at a depth of 92.5 km.
Earlier, seismologists recorded a 7.5 magnitude earthquake in Peru, during which ten people were injured.

Ukraine will start producing a new generation of jet drones
At the new Ukrainian-Turkish plant, they will begin to create ANKA-type jet unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs).
This was reported on December 11 by the freelance adviser to the head of the Ukrainian president's office, Aleksei Arestovich.
That is, they are capable of acting against aerial objects, against other drones.
Even against manned aircraft.
They will have Ukrainian engines and the rest of the Turkish avionics: hull and the like," Dialog.ua quotes him as saying.
Commenting on the main features of ANKA vehicles, Arestovich said that we are talking about reactive, not piston UAVs.
According to him, this is a new generation of drones after Bayraktar, which exceed it "in all characteristics."
The first batch of UAVs should be produced by the plant at the end of next year, concluded Arestovich.
The ANKA aircraft was created by the Turkish Aerospace Agency in February 2014.
The development of the drone has been carried out by the Turkish authorities in cooperation with a number of private companies since 2010.
The day before, the Ukrainian General Staff classified data on the use of Bayraktar drones and Javelin missile systems during the military operations of the joint forces in Donbass.
On December 6, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky announced that the construction of a plant for the production of modern military drones had begun in the country.
According to him, Ukraine intends to use drones.
On September 29, Bayraktar Savunma and the Ukrainian Ministry of Defense entered into an agreement on the construction of a center in the Kiev region, which will provide personnel training, as well as testing and maintenance of Turkish Bayraktar UAVs.
The press service of the office of the Ukrainian leader called this memorandum "a big real step forward."
Two lions escaped from a container at the airport
Lions have escaped at Singapore's Changi Airport.
The Straits Times reports about this.
Two of the predators managed to escape from a container with seven lions that arrived on one of the planes.
The publication notes that it remains unknown from which country they were brought to Singapore, and where they were heading.
One of the escaped lions lay down on the roof of the container.
The animals could not get away from him because of the protective netting installed nearby.
The standoff ended after staff from the Mandai Wildlife Group, which oversees all Singapore zoos, arrived at the airport.
They immobilized the lions with tranquilizer darts and plan to take them to a quarantine facility.
Earlier it was reported that in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, a lion escaped from its owner and roamed the streets of the city.
On the same day, the animal voluntarily returned home, people were not injured.
Experts warned about the threat of cancer due to vitamin B9
Research suggests that excess vitamin B9, also known as folic acid, can lead to cancer.
The Daily Express warned about this.
According to experts, there is strong evidence that people who are not deficient in folic acid have a lower risk of developing certain types of cancer, in particular, colorectal.
However, exceeding the required dose, on the contrary, promotes the growth of cancer cells.
Nutritionist Beth Kitchin, a professor at the University of Alabama at Birmingham, advises monitoring the amount of folic acid consumed throughout the day.
The optimal dose is 400 micrograms per day.
The threat of cancer increases only if you significantly deviate from this figure to a greater or lesser extent.
Kitchin recommends not taking vitamin B9 pills without a doctor's recommendation, be sure to monitor the dosage and avoid cereal with milk and other foods that contain folic acid.
Earlier, nutrition consultant Rachel Fine called folic acid a substance that slows down aging.
Since it is found in avocados, among other things, Fine recommended that men over 50 should eat this fruit more often.
In the UK, by April, about 75 thousand people may die because of the omicron strain
Forecasts by British scientists show that due to the spread of the omicron strain of coronavirus, up to 75 thousand people could die in England in the next five months, if restrictive measures are not tightened in the winter.
This was reported by The Guardian newspaper, citing a study by experts from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine (LSHTM), TASS reports.
According to the most optimistic forecast of specialists who are part of the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies at the British Cabinet Office, by April 2022, at least 25 thousand deaths will be recorded in the country due to the omicron strain, and a total of about 175 thousand patients will be hospitalized.
At the same time, at the peak of the morbidity, hospitals will receive more than 2 thousand infected people daily.
"A major coronavirus response may be needed to prevent the NHS being overwhelmed if the omicron strain turns out to be more infectious than the delta variant, and current vaccines are unable to rule out infections," said mathematician Roseanna Barnard from LSHTM.
Earlier, the Health Protection Agency of Great Britain informed: if the rate of spread of the omicron strain continues at the current level, then by the end of the year about 1 million cases of infection will be detected in the country.
At the same time, by mid-December, the omicron strain may become dominant in the United Kingdom.
At the moment, 1898 cases of infection with the omicron strain of coronavirus have been detected in the UK, of which 633 were detected in the last 24 hours.
At the same time, on December 9, the head of the British Ministry of Health, Sajid Javid, indicated that in reality this figure could already reach 10 thousand cases.

The global demand for superyachts has grown by a quarter
The construction of superyachts this year and orders for next year are breaking all records in the world, despite calls to reduce the carbon footprint and combat climate change.
In the global ship register, the number of yachts ordered amounted to 1,200 units - a quarter more than last year.
In an era of climate action to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, it is hard to imagine that the number of people who have the desire and money for a floating fortress for 50 million pounds and above will not decrease, writes "The Guardian."
However, they are becoming more numerous.
This year, 25% more vessels were ordered than in the previous year.
Brokers say that there has not been such a rush on the market for 20 years.
The first reason is that many who can afford a yacht are afraid of infection on land and prefer to escape the pandemic on board their own vessel.
The second reason is also related to the coronavirus.
If earlier all these people went to the office and met with business partners in person, now the absolute majority of them work remotely, and negotiations are conducted via Zoom.
Broker Will Christie told the newspaper that shipyards are taking orders for new yachts for 2025 and beyond.
This means that customers are willing to pay more, if only their yacht was ready at least a year or two earlier.
"People just crave freedom, and the super rich could afford it," he says.
In Western society, many criticize this behavior of the rich and call it decadent.
The rich, sociologists say, do not want to understand that in times of hardship, space travel, living on yachts or flying in their own planes cause irritation in society, since the elite does not want to share responsibility for climate change with the rest of humanity.
Economists are calling on governments to act and propose new taxes and regulations for the super-rich, although they understand that with such mobility of money, it will be extremely difficult to implement.
Meanwhile, only the number of ordered super-yachts is impressive, but also their characteristics.
Of the 1,200 vessels, 27 have a stern length of more than 100 metres.
Norwegian billionaire Rekke is building the 183 meter yacht REV Ocean.
Once launched, it will be the largest yacht in the world.
The yacht has a "moon pool," as well as a submarine designed to explore the depths of the sea.
On existing super-yachts, helicopter pads, open-air cinemas, and on some of them, as, for example, on the fighter McGregor's yacht, a platform for martial arts, have become common.Professor of economic anthropology at the American University in Indiana, Richard Wilke, says that compared to the total number of greenhouse gas emissions, the carbon footprint produced by the super-rich is insignificant.
But it has symbolic significance, given that there are just over 2,000 multi-billionaires in the world.
It's just another example of overconsumption by a very small group of people.
Scientists have found that the emissions footprint of billionaires is thousands of times greater than that of the average inhabitant of the planet.
If one person produces an average of 5 tons of CO2 per year, then the planet's biggest polluter, Roman Abramovich, is responsible for 33.9 tons of greenhouse gases released into the atmosphere in 2018.
At the same time, two-thirds of the emissions footprint came from his 162.5-meter yacht Eclipse.
Even if the owner is not on board the yacht, the team continues to poison the planet.
The owner can call the captain and give the command to drive the yacht, for example, from the Mediterranean to the Caribbean.
Superyacht owners don't get much sympathy from others when they, like Australia's richest woman Gina Rinehart, who owns mines on the continent, complain via YouTube that there is no berth for their giant vessels.
It is also difficult to understand her call to build marinas for vessels with a draught of less than 50 metres.
Dangerous weekly dose of alcohol leading to bowel cancer identified
American scientists have determined what volume of alcoholic beverages per week increases the risk of developing cancer.
The Daily Express writes about this.
Experts came to the conclusion that the consumption of four or more servings of alcoholic beverages per week is associated with an increased risk of developing cancer.
At the same time, the likelihood of developing the disease increases with the amount of alcohol consumed.
What's more, moderate male drinkers have a higher risk of bowel cancer than women.
Scientists cannot determine the exact cause of the development of this type of oncology, noting only that certain factors lead to a process that is harmful to the body.

Dogs can understand words and phrases at the level of a two-year-old
Many, or rather all dog lovers are sure that these creatures are very intelligent.
But even they have no idea how advanced these four-legged pets really are.
Over the years, biologists have conducted various experiments to find out for sure how the intelligence of animals is developed.
Although a dog's vocabulary is not as extensive as a human's, a new study proves that a dog can consistently respond to 89 words or phrases.
The scientists' work was published in the journal Sciencealert.
Dogs can't play chess or write poetry, they don't understand politics, economics or art, yet they often manage to fool their owners.
Representatives of some breeds, experts believe, show better results in understanding the words of the human language, but there is not yet enough statistical data for accurate conclusions.
For example, some breeds are traditionally considered to be canine geniuses - for example, Labradors.
Scientists came to the conclusion that dogs are capable of logical thinking, and their ability to learn is not inferior to that of a two-year-old child.

In Ukraine, they prepared for trade between the US and Russia
The United States and Russia will "bargain" over Ukraine's entry into NATO, analyst Alexander Kochetkov said in his article for Glavred.
In his opinion, Washington and Moscow plan to continue negotiations in the near future regarding the guarantees of the United States that Ukraine will not join the North Atlantic Alliance, despite the words of the American leader Joe Biden about the right of countries to "join anywhere."
If you are offered something that is obviously unacceptable, for example, to sell a close relative into sexual slavery, you will not bargain, but simply send the offerer.
And in relation to Ukraine, a bargain is being planned," the analyst wrote.
Kochetkov added that Russia does not plan to attack Ukraine, but seeks dialogue with Kiev.
"Preparations are carried out covertly, and they quickly and immediately go on the offensive, rather than waiting for the group to be discovered and counter-forces deployed," he noted.
China promotes the development of the railway industry
China's advanced technologies attracted the attention of companies from the United States, Germany, France and other countries at the 2021 China International Rail Vehicle and Equipment Exhibition held in Zhuzhou, Hunan Province (Central China).
The core technologies developed by CRRC Zhuzhou Locomotive Co. Ltd. allow trains to automatically detect and diagnose technical faults, said company representative Hou Zhaowen.
The high-speed trains running on the China-Laos railway line, which was put into operation at the beginning of this month, are already equipped with these technologies, which will ensure increased reliability and performance of the rolling stock.
Over the past six months, China has significantly increased the export of railway vehicles, and many countries in Asia and Europe are witnessing "Chinese speed."
In May this year, CRRC Zhuzhou Locomotive Co., Ltd rolled out the first domestically developed double-deck high-speed electric trains for export to Europe.
With a maximum operating speed of 200 kilometers per hour, these trains will run on the railways of Austria, Germany, Hungary and other European countries.
In November, the trial operation of the metro train developed by the above-mentioned company for Turkey began.
The train will move along the metro line connecting the center of Istanbul with the city's airport.
Traffic on this metro line will be opened next year.
It will be the fastest metro line in Turkey with a speed of 120 kilometers per hour.
"China's railway equipment industry is one of the industries with the highest level of innovation and the strongest international innovative competitiveness," said Feng Yaosiang, head of the trade and investment department of the China Council for the Promotion of International Trade (CCPIT).
"This industry is the main competitive advantage of China's high-end equipment production in the global market," said Feng Yaoxiang.
After more than 60 years of hard work, through a series of independent research and development, China has established an advanced railway equipment manufacturing system, with a complete set of supporting facilities and large-scale production activities.
According to Feng Yaosiang, the country ranks first in terms of railway electrification and operating mileage on high-speed and urban railways.
Biologist listed the early signs of dementia
Candidate of Biological Sciences Semyon Golosheikin, in an interview with Sputnik radio, listed the early signs of dementia.
According to him, signs of future dementia can be forgetfulness, as well as a number of mild cognitive impairments, such as inability to concentrate, plan, and a decrease in the level of abstract thinking.
There is currently a debate that hearing loss can be both an early manifestation of Alzheimer's disease and one of the risk factors for its occurrence, the specialist said.
Golosheikin stressed that the causes of dementia can be neurodegenerative disorders, head injuries, certain infections, metabolic disorders, and a lack of certain vitamins.
He added that Alzheimer's disease and atherosclerosis of cerebral vessels are the most frequent causes of this syndrome.
The biologist noted that to date, doctors do not know effective ways to treat dementia.
Therefore, it is necessary to start its prevention in time.
According to him, learning foreign languages and active communication will help reduce the risk of developing dementia.
WHO also recommends maintaining a moderate level of physical activity, regularly training cognitive skills through games and hobbies that require intensive involvement of memory and logic of thinking.
"There are recommendations for the use of various dietary supplements, but their effectiveness and appropriateness are still being discussed in the scientific community," Golosheikin said.
"The World Health Organization recommends maintaining a moderate level of physical activity, regular training of cognitive skills and abilities with the help of games and hobbies that require intensive involvement of memory and logic of thinking," Golosheikin said.
Earlier, the charity Dementia Research UK said the disease was increasingly affecting people in their 40s.
Doctors have named the early symptoms of Alzheimer's disease.
The first warning sign can be considered problems with vision, due to which the patient acquires difficulties in recognizing objects.
Another sign of developing dementia, experts called aphasia - a condition when a person cannot find the right words to convey what he wants to say.
The neurologist demanded to send Saakashvili for treatment abroad
The former president of Georgia, Mikhail Saakashvili, is in need of psycho-nervous treatment and rehabilitation abroad, neurologist Otar Toidze, who is a member of the doctors' council created under the Georgian Ombudsman, told reporters.
His [Saakashvili's] neurological status is the leading factor in his illness.
Stable problems are problems with movement, coordination, variability of character," the specialist said, noting that this does not go beyond the regulatory framework and now the ex-president needs to be sent for special rehabilitation.
"This is what we call neurorehabilitation and psycho-nervous rehabilitation, the possibility of which we have not found in Georgia," Toidze noted, demanding that Saakashvili be treated in a special institution, which Georgia does not have.
On the evening of December 7, Saakashvili began to sabotage receiving medical care after the penitentiary service officers subjected him to disciplinary punishment.
The Georgian politician quickly managed to overturn the punishment and restore his former rights.

In Spain, there were protests against COVID passports
In the Spanish cities of Barcelona and Valencia, protests were held against the mandatory certificate of vaccination against COVID-19, reports the Europa Press agency.
In the Catalan capital, the number of participants in the action was approximately 3 thousand people.
In Barcelona, COVID-passports have become mandatory for going to bars, restaurants, gyms, nursing homes and night entertainment venues.
Many demonstrators came to the action without masks.
With slogans on their placard, they accused the state of totalitarianism and called for the choice of citizens to be respected.
In Valencia, vaccination certificates will also be required to enter entertainment venues and restaurants with a capacity of more than 50 people.
Protesters in the city denounced a medical dictatorship and called the vaccination an experiment.
In Spain, more than 5.2 million cases of coronavirus infection have been detected since the beginning of the pandemic, and more than 88 thousand patients have died.
Russia also plans to introduce restrictions for the unvaccinated.
The government submitted draft laws on a unified QR code system to the State Duma on November 12.
It is assumed that Russians will be able to visit the venues of mass events, cultural institutions, catering and retail facilities with the presentation of either a certificate of vaccination or illness, or a certificate of vaccination.
The same rules will apply to travel by train and plane.

Steep ascent: how the Chinese become downhill skiers
The Olympics should attract millions of people to the slopes and help create world-class resorts in the country
In China, it is hoped that the Olympics will not only attract 300 million citizens to winter sports, which will allow the collection of 1 trillion yuan designated by President Xi Jinping, but will also contribute to the economic development of backward remote provinces.
The Taiwu Ski Resort in Zhangjiakou, located near the site of the Winter Olympics, is becoming increasingly popular with the Chinese.
In addition to the construction of infrastructure, landscaping work is also being carried out in the region: workers are planting trees.
There are more than 700 ski resorts in the country, but only 20 of them are large enough to host international competitions.
In many regions of China where resorts are located, including Zhangjiakou, there are problems with snow.
The main long-term task is to provide comfortable and interesting holidays at Chinese resorts, so that all newcomers become regulars.
However, this is still a long way off.
Games adviser Justin Downes says China's ski industry has changed beyond recognition since his last visit in 2007.
Every year, more and more Chinese go to the slopes in winter.
Fiona, a snowboarder from Beijing, is one of them.
Despite the major changes, it will take many more years to create a ski culture here, says Downes.
Many resorts are in agricultural and mining areas.
These regions still have to actively develop and create the necessary infrastructure for recreation there.
Gao Makong, 70, lives in Chunli, near the Winter Olympics.
He notes that in recent years there has been a boom in winter sports tourism.
Two years ago, a high-speed railway was built from Beijing to Chongli, and now none of the local residents are out of work.
More and more shops selling clothing and equipment for winter sports are opening in the country.
On the slopes, they are opening catering points with national cuisine.
Taiwu now even has a COVID-19 testing station.
China is striving to create a thriving winter sports industry, its athletes should become leaders of major international competitions, and resorts and equipment should reach world standards.
More than 500 million people in the world may face extreme poverty due to the pandemic, the WHO said
More than 500 million people in the world may be plunged into extreme poverty due to the coronavirus pandemic, which has slowed down the progress of mankind in the issue of universal access to health services, said the World Health Organization (WHO) and the World Bank (WB).
On the occasion of the International Day of Universal Health Coverage on December 12, WHO and the World Bank published two complementary reports.
In them, they stated that the pandemic led to disruptions in the provision of medical services, caused excessive stress in health care systems.
In this regard, for the first time in 10 years, immunization coverage has decreased, and mortality from tuberculosis and malaria has increased.
The WHO and the World Bank stressed that the pandemic has caused "the worst economic crisis since the 1930s, so it has become more difficult for people to pay for treatment."
This situation pushes more than 500 million people "into extreme poverty because they have to pay for these services out of their own pockets."
In October, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said that the coronavirus pandemic has plunged more than 100 million people into poverty, and more than four billion people have virtually no social support.

Optional sawdust removal system: left or right side.

Reuters: Taiwanese minister cut from "Democracy Summit" broadcast at White House request
The speech of the Minister of Digital Technologies of Taiwan, Audrey Tan, at a panel discussion during the US-organized "Summit for Democracy" was transferred to a mode without video, according to the recording of the summit on YouTube.
Reuters, citing sources, claims that the image was disabled at the request of the White House.
According to their report, the reason was a map on which Taiwan was highlighted in a separate color from the PRC, which considers the island its territory.
The map that Ms. Tan showed was compiled by CIVICUS, a South African nongovernmental organization, and ranked the countries of the world according to the degree of civil rights.
Taiwan was highlighted in green as "free," and the PRC, DPRK, Laos and Vietnam in red as "closed."
After the minister showed the map, the image on its side was replaced with a screenshot with a note that the opinions of the participants in the discussion "do not necessarily express the position of the US government."
The PRC was not invited to the "Summit for Democracy."
Reuters sources note that the map shown by the Taiwanese minister could run counter to Washington's "one China" policy.
One of the agency's sources said that after the map was shown, the US National Security Council angrily contacted the State Department, accusing it of showing Taiwan as a separate country.
Organized by Washington, the "Summit for Democracy" was held from December 9 to 10 with the participation of representatives of 110 countries and territories, as well as civil associations and charitable organizations.
Russia was not invited to the summit.
During the "zero day" of the summit, the Nobel Peace Prize laureate, editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta, Dmitry Muratov, called for the creation of an international fund through which money obtained through corruption would be donated to charity.
Earlier today, Deputy Secretary of the Security Council of the Russian Federation, Yuri Averyanov, stated that the summit carried an "anti-Russian and anti-Chinese charge."

They do not boil the meat, but the horns and hooves, producing a glue-like substance.
The finished product looks like a yellow translucent strip, almost odorless and hard as plastic, and is used as a natural gelatin.

The New Shepard spacecraft with six tourists on board made a suborbital flight
Blue Origin's New Shepard spacecraft with six tourists on board made a suborbital flight on Saturday, December 11.
The journey, which was broadcast on the company's website, lasted a total of more than ten minutes, after which the capsule with passengers descended to Earth, TASS reports.
The launch of the carrier rocket was carried out from the cosmodrome near the American city of Van Horn (Texas).
The ship rose to an altitude of just over 100 km, and the space tourists found themselves in a state of weightlessness.
The launch vehicle itself landed normally on the site of the cosmodrome.
On July 20, Blue Origin successfully carried out the first suborbital flight of the New Shepard spacecraft with passengers on board.

China strengthens prevention and control of COVID-19 epidemic in cities with land border checkpoints
The Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism of the State Council of the People's Republic of China issued a circular ordering to strengthen the prevention and control of the COVID-19 epidemic in cities where land border checkpoints are located in order to further prevent the infection from being imported from abroad.
According to the circular, people leaving these cities must provide a negative COVID-19 nucleic acid test result obtained within 48 hours before departure.
Those arriving at cities with land ports of entry are required to take at least one COVID-19 nucleic acid test upon arrival.
The document states that these requirements will be in effect from the day when the relevant provincial-level administrative units determine and publish the zones of the specified cities until March 15, 2022.
In addition, it is noted that cities with land border checkpoints that meet certain conditions may consider the possibility of creating buffer zones for the prevention and control of the COVID-19 epidemic within their jurisdiction.

The Foreign Ministry spoke about the "sad conclusion" in relations between Russia and the United States
In an interview with Izvestia, Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov assessed the prospects for relations between Moscow and Washington.
He noted that the long path of cooperation has led to sad conclusions, and the problems between the two countries did not begin yesterday.
There is a one-sided negative predictability, but in terms of any prospects for improving relations, everything is completely unpredictable.
This is a sad conclusion to the long road we have traveled with the current administration, with Trump, and with Obama.
The problems did not start yesterday," the diplomat pointed out.
According to Ryabkov, the problems are related to the US's desire to impose approaches on Russia on a number of issues.
The deputy head of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs added that he would not risk giving optimistic forecasts about the prospects for improving relations and would not expect a change in Washington's position.
He explained that with the exception of such areas as strategic stability and cybersecurity, no progress has been observed.
At the same time, Russia calls on the United States to take a responsible approach in matters of international security and hopes that the signals will be heard and the Americans will listen to the arguments of common sense.
Earlier, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said at a meeting with U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken that Moscow is ready to resume dialogue with the United States.
Virologist warns of COVID nasal vaccine dangers outside hospitals
Those who have been vaccinated with a nasal vaccine against COVID-19 may develop allergies and need medical help, so the first points for inoculation with this drug should not be organized at airports and shopping centers.
This was reported to TASS by virologist, corresponding member of the Russian Academy of Sciences, head of the laboratory of bionanotechnology, microbiology and virology at Novosibirsk State University, Sergei Netesov.
It is easier to set up nasal vaccination points at airports and shopping centres, but I would only do this in medical institutions at first.
The fact is that the probability of an allergic reaction to such a vaccine exists, it is small, but it is desirable that the person then sits next to the doctor's office.
Doctors have special sets of anti-allergic drugs that act literally in a minute or two, which is sometimes very necessary," said Netesov.
According to the virologist, it will be possible to think about vaccination in shopping centers when experience is gained in the use of the drug.
He also stressed that when using a nasal vaccine, it is important that it gets on the mucous membrane in the nasal cavity.
At the same time, there is a possibility that the vaccine will not reach the destination if the inoculated person with nasal congestion blows his nose after injection.

Serbia has produced 2 million doses of Sputnik V vaccine
The Sputnik V vaccine is most popular in Serbia.
Serbia has produced about 2 million doses of the Russian vaccine "Sputnik V," the country's Minister of Innovation and Technological Development Nenad Popovich told TASS.
"The Torlak State Institute has so far produced about 2 million doses of the Sputnik V vaccine, and we expect that at least 4 million doses will be produced in the coming period," Popovich stated.
According to him, the Russian vaccine is the most popular among Serbs.
In this regard, the republic plans to purchase an additional million doses of the vaccine from Russia.
The Minister of Innovation and Technological Development of Serbia also expressed interest in the production of the nasal vaccine "Sputnik V" and the drug "Sputnik Light" on the territory of the state.
Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin reported that the Russian Federation has delivered to Serbia almost two million doses of the domestic vaccine against coronavirus infection "Sputnik V."

In the UK, 1239 cases of the omicron strain of coronavirus were recorded per day - RT in Russian
During the day, 1239 cases of infection with the new omicron strain of coronavirus were detected in the UK.
Sky News reports about this.
In particular, 1,196 new cases of the omicron strain were recorded in England, 38 people fell ill with a new type of infection in Scotland and five in Northern Ireland.
The total number of COVID-19 cases from the new strain in the UK has reached 3,137 people.
Earlier, scientists at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine in a pessimistic forecast calculated that 75 thousand people could die in England by April due to the outbreak of coronavirus caused by the "omicron" strain.

New Caledonians reject independence from France
According to the final results of the third referendum on the independence of New Caledonia, the overwhelming majority of participants refused to secede from France.
This was reported on December 12 by the French television channel BFM.TV.
96.5% of voters were against independence.
3.51% of the inhabitants of the archipelago in the South Pacific supported independence from France.
The results of 2.99% of ballots were annulled.
The level of participation in the voting on this day was very low: about 55% of the inhabitants of the archipelago came to the polling stations.
According to experts, the low turnout is explained by the calls of the separatists to refuse to participate in the referendum because of the coronavirus.
Paris refused to postpone the date of the referendum.
In October 2020, New Caledonians voted against independence from France in a referendum.
In 2018, a referendum on independence was already held in the region.
The majority of residents supported the archipelago being part of France.
New Caledonia is almost 20 thousand kilometers from mainland France.
In 1853, France claimed New Caledonia as its own.
About 270 thousand people live on the archipelago, the territory is endowed with a special administrative and territorial status.
Paris and the New Caledonian government have a 1998 agreement, according to which the region can organize a vote on its independence twice, two years apart.

WHO tentatively considers "omicron" less dangerous than "delta"
The World Health Organization (WHO) tentatively believes that "omicron" is less dangerous than the delta strain of coronavirus.
At the same time, there is evidence of a decrease in the effectiveness of vaccines in the event of a new variant of COVID-19.
According to information as of December 9, "omicron" is registered in 63 countries.
"Preliminary data and the significantly altered antigenic profile of the protein of the "omicron" strain suggest a decrease in the effectiveness of the vaccine against infection and transmission of the variant.
According to preliminary findings from South Africa, it is assumed that it ("severity of the disease" - ed.) may be less severe than with "delta,"" the WHO technical report says.
The organization notes that so far all reported cases of infection with "omicron" in the EU are mild or asymptomatic.
At the same time, the new strain, according to preliminary data, spreads faster than the "delta."
Two cases of infection with the omicron strain have been registered in Russia.
They were "previously immunized," the Gamaleya Center reported.
The head of Rospotrebnadzor, Anna Popova, stated that so far there is no reliable data that the new variant of the coronavirus is less dangerous than the others.

Ukraine has named four scenarios for Zelensky
Ex-deputy of the Verkhovna Rada Vadim Denisenko listed four options for the development of events for President of Ukraine Vladimir Zelensky in 2022.
In his opinion, the head of state may be left without the support of the West, and may also compromise on Donbass.
Denisenko spoke about this on Sunday, December 12, in a publication on the Glavred portal.
The first option, which Denisenko called a "perfect storm," suggests that key Western countries will stop supporting Ukraine, having reached an agreement on the country's future without its participation.
Such a development of events will contribute to a deep crisis that Kiev may face in 2023.
"At the same time, there is a decrease in prices for key goods that we traditionally export <...> internal protests and confrontation between the authorities and key FIGs (financial and industrial groups. - Ed.)," the ex-parliamentarian added.
According to Denisenko, there is another scenario for the development of the situation - "a war against everyone."
This forecast will come true in the event of high turbulence in world politics, in which the Ukrainian authorities will face a number of problems.
Due to this state of affairs, the leadership of Ukraine may make compromises on Donbass, as a result of which a confrontation within the country is possible.
At the end of the summer, Zelensky's position will weaken, the probability of such a situation, according to the former people's deputy, is up to 50-55%.
The third scenario for the development of the situation in Ukrainian politics is a confrontation between groups of the population that disagree with Zelensky and the president, which is likely to lead to the seizure of control over the power bloc and the implementation of "populist initiatives."
In the course of this version of the crisis, Zelensky will begin "reformatting the government," Denisenko added.
Another scenario is the transformation of Zelensky into the "father of the nation."
An event that will be a strong shock to society may lead to this.
"The event should be large enough to cause a reaction from external partners and lead to an increase in support for Ukraine," Denisenko said.
This scenario is possible as a result of a natural disaster, a man-made catastrophe or Russia's aggressive actions, the ex-deputy believes.
At the same time, the Russian side has more than once rejected any possibility of an "attack" on Ukraine.
Moscow noted that it is the Ukrainian authorities, NATO and the United States that are increasing military activity near the Russian borders.
Earlier, on November 11, the survey data of the sociological group "Rating" showed that the rating of the Ukrainian president fell to record lows, amounting to 19.3%.
This is the lowest figure since his election as head of state.
Analysts predicted a situation in which, in the case of the next presidential elections in Ukraine, only 21.8% would vote for Zelensky, while 14.5% would vote for the former president of the country, Petro Poroshenko.
At the same time, only 19.3% of all respondents expressed support for the president.

The product of the brand "Butison" from the "Sense" series is designed for a healthy sleep for people suffering from diseases of the joints and vascular system.
The design ensures even load distribution across the surface and a pronounced comfort effect.
The basis of the Beautison Sens Hard S600 mini Synt mattress is the independent S600 mini spring unit with reduced spring height.
Beautyson uses spunbond, coconut coir and polyurethane foam as internal fillers.
Spunbond serves as an intermediate insulating layer between soft materials and springs.
The orthopedic foam with charcoal impregnation is decorated on the surface with a curly edge, which provides a micromassage effect.
Coconut coir is a hypoallergenic material that gives the mattress high moisture exchange and breathability characteristics.
The outer case for the mattress is made of dense jacquard with synthetic fibers.
The material is strong and durable, does not wear out and does not require complex care.
Poet arrested for protest on Red Square: "They give 10 days for quoting Yevtushenko, that's the power of poetry!"
At the beginning of the week, 21-year-old poet Alexander Volchenkov was arrested for ten days.
A student of the Higher School of Economics was detained on Red Square with a poster on which the hashtag #poetvrosiibolshechampionpoet was written.
This quote belongs to the writer Yevgeny Yevtushenko.
A protocol was drawn up against Alexander under an administrative article on repeated violation of the procedure for holding a public action.
He was first detained on 23 January on Pushkin Square, at a rally in support of Alexei Navalny.
"The goal was to draw attention to poetry in general, now interest in it, unfortunately, has been lost, to the decline of general culture in Russia, and there is also little hope of inspiring unknown poets to write their poems on the Internet under this hashtag," explains Alexander.
We contacted the young poet to find out the circumstances of the arrest and to reveal the message of his message in more detail.
How did the police officers treat you during the arrest this time and previously?
What did the department ask, how did they comment on your action?
This time, the officers were more correct, the detention was maximum, polite, no matter how ridiculous it may sound in a certain context of this word.
At Pushkinskaya, the riot police took and took hard.
They asked the standard questions about motives.
When they heard, in principle, they looked, if not approvingly, then understandably.
With the exception of the monkey being blown to all 4 sides, everything was extremely correct, but I knew what I was getting into.
And if, after the action, at least a few people start writing their poems under this hashtag, I will have served these 10 days for a reason.

Researchers told how potatoes help in the fight against age-related disorders
The study showed that potatoes are rich in vitamins and trace elements that help improve blood circulation and lower cholesterol.
The root vegetable contains B vitamins, vitamin C, phosphorus, potassium, magnesium, riboflavin, folic and pantothenic acids.
All these elements help the body's systems to function.
In addition, potatoes help in the fight against age-related disorders.
Due to the high content of clove, it is useful for the gastrointestinal tract, and with regular use can also help in the prevention of hypertension and atherosclerosis.
However, for the greatest benefit, it is better to stew or boil the root vegetable, rather than fry it in oil.
Earlier, The Daily Express warned that potatoes could be dangerous for diabetics, as well as other foods with a high glycemic index.
These are foods containing carbohydrates that are quickly broken down into sugars, such as table sugar, sugary soft drinks, white rice, and white bread.
In early December, the Kommersant newspaper warned of a possible shortage of Russian table potatoes, noting a reduction in its production in private farms and an increase in processing capacity.
According to market participants, the shortage of products at the moment can only be replaced by imports.
Lostfilm, lordfilm and other pirates will be removed from Yandex distribution
Candidates for departure
In 2015, copyright holders from the RAEC/Media cluster compiled a list of the 100 largest pirate sites on the Runet, and most of them ceased to exist, says Karen Kazaryan, general director of the Internet Research Institute.
But some - Kinogo, Lostfilm, Filmix - still managed to survive thanks to, among other things, regular domain name changes, he adds.
For example, on Lostfilm, which is available in the search results of both Yandex and Google, you can watch pirated copies of the Netflix series "The Squid Game" and "Tenderness" directed by Anna Melikyan - the original series of Russia's largest video service ivi (included in the AIV).
On Kinogo, which is also available in the search results, you can watch the animation novelty "Encanto," but judging by the quality of the video, it is a so-called screencast (a pirated copy of the film shot in a cinema).
On Filmix, which can also be found through search engines, the series "Univer. 10 years later" of the TNT TV channel (part of Gazprom-Media) is available.

Mattress Dimax Micro Ultimate, size 160x190
Micro Ultimate orthopedic spring mattress.
The model is convenient in that it has two surfaces of different softness - high hardness and slightly more than average.
The composition of the product includes only high-quality and premium fillers, which have proven themselves exclusively from the best side.
Springs: in the center of the model there is a block of independent springs "micropackage."
This means that there are 2000 coils per berth, which work completely autonomously.
It is their functioning that provides a unique fine-tuning.
"Micropackage" is the highest-frequency of the entire variety of Dimax spring blocks, therefore it has a pronounced orthopedic effect and is considered premium.
Fillings: Combinations of coir and natural latex layers are installed on the top and bottom of the springs.
The only difference is the order of the plates.
If one surface has latex, the other has coconut coir.
Such a tandem of fillers has long had the status of a classic, since it conveys to the mattress not only orthopedic, but also anatomical properties.
If the coir provides the right support for the back, then the latex gives the surface adaptation to the human body.
Case: The model comes in a simple Aloe Vera knitted case.
At the request of the client, it can be made both removable and stationary.
The total height of the product is 27 cm, the recommended load on the bed is 170 kg.
Warranty and safety: the warranty period is 3 years.
The mattress has received all the necessary certificates and documents that confirm its complete safety and reliability in operation.
The orthopedic foam used in the mattress is CertiPUR certified.
Estonian scientists will search for life on Venus
The Massachusetts Institute of Technology, in cooperation with the Tartu Observatory and other research institutions and companies, is preparing three space missions to Venus to search for signs of life in the atmosphere, the Actual Camera reported on Sunday.
The goal of the missions starting in five years is to assess the habitability of the clouds of Venus, and then search for life there.
For the project, Tartu scientists have proposed instruments for measuring the acidity and oxygen content in the clouds of Venus.
Until now it has been assumed that the clouds of Venus, the planet closest to Earth, are too acidic for life to exist there, but it is likely that Venus was originally a terrestrial planet.
During the third mission, a sample from Venus should arrive.
Suppose that if we find life there, the main question will be whether it is similar to the earth or different.
If very similar, it will be obvious that terrestrial life did not begin on Earth.
If it is different, then perhaps it will be more likely that life originated on Earth," said Mihkel Pajusalu, head of the Estonian Venus Life Finder project team.

Metaverse will change Russian business
The theme of metaverse became popular this fall, when Mark Zuckerberg announced the transformation of Facebook into Meta.
For the market, this event was an important signal: the largest player confirmed the development of a new format of digital interaction between people.
This means that business in Russia, as well as around the world, will invest in the creation of their own metaverse and their subsequent monetization.
Metaverse should be considered as a continuation of objectively existing trends.
On the one hand, the trend towards creating remote interactions in a pandemic, because people are tired of separation and restrictions.
On the other hand, it is a consequence of the desire of business to develop ecosystems and adapt operating models to them.
Thirdly, they are a logical continuation of the trend of digitalization of assets, when any rights, securities, works of art and even money are transferred to a digital format.

The British economist could not give a forecast for 2022
British economist Jim O'Neill could not give a forecast for 2022, because, in his opinion, such attempts will turn into a failure.
He wrote about this in an article for Project Syndicate.
The expert believes that the next year will be full of unpredictability and any trend can change the turnover.
The most important factor remains the coronavirus pandemic, and inflation is in second place, he believes.
O'Neill also admitted that he does not know whether the increase in the price of goods is temporary or not.
As the expert pointed out, even before the pandemic, it was clear that "the world of endless generosity of central banks has already exhausted itself" and it is time to return to a relationship where interest rates, taking into account inflation, will correlate with expected GDP growth rates.
O'Neill noted that against the backdrop of the pandemic, the continuation of ultra-soft economic policy could, according to some experts, lead to a new surge in inflation.
In addition, attention should be paid to the issue of productivity growth, as well as increasing poverty and climate change, O'Neill concluded.
Earlier, Mikhail Shulgin, head of the global research department at Otkritie Investments, reported that positive expectations for the dollar exchange rate for 2022 remain, while the growth potential will be less significant.
Among the risks for the dollar, Shulgin named the Fed's monetary policy, the dynamics of oil prices and fears against the backdrop of the coronavirus pandemic.

Russians gave car dealers about 4.5% of the country's GDP
According to the results of 10 months of 2021, Russians spent 2 trillion 784 billion rubles on the purchase of new cars, which is 28% more than in the same period last year, according to statistics from the agency Russian Automotive Market Research (NAPI).
To understand the scale, approximately the same amount (about 3 trillion rubles) was spent by the state to support citizens and the economy during the coronavirus pandemic.
Last September, at a meeting of the heads of the countries of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, President Vladimir Putin said that this amount is comparable to more than 4.5% of the country's gross domestic product (GDP) for 2020.
The Korean brand Kia is the market leader in Russia in terms of revenue.
For 10 months of this year, it managed to sell cars worth 325.7 billion rubles, which is almost 24% more than a year earlier.
The growth of Kia's sister brand Hyundai is even more significant - more than 35%, and the proceeds from the sale of cars are estimated at 279.3 billion rubles.
This brand is also in the leading positions in terms of the increase in the weighted average price of the car - for the year at Hyundai, it increased by almost 21%, to 1.94 million rubles - only Changan, Chery, Geely and Mercedes-Benz had stronger dynamics of price increase.
At the same time, the sales volumes of Korean brands did not grow so significantly: according to the statistics of the Automobile Manufacturers Committee of the Association of European Businesses in Russia, in quantitative terms, Kia sold 9.4% more cars in the same period than a year earlier.
Hyundai - by almost 12%.
Japanese Toyota closes the top three in terms of sales in monetary terms - Russians spent 275.5 billion rubles on cars of this brand in 10 months, which is 14% more than a year earlier.
The Japanese are followed by Mercedes-Benz with an indicator of 266.1 billion rubles (+75%) - the German premium brand increased both the volume of sales (by 37%) and the weighted average price of the car (by almost 28%, to 8.2 million rubles).
"At the same time, Mercedes-Benz has a good increase in sales and weighted average price - more, for example, than BMW - hence the greater increase in financial capacity, - explained Tatiana Arabadzhi, General Director of NAPI. -
In terms of sales growth, Chinese brands, which have also significantly increased their financial capacity this year, are demonstrating fantastic performance."
The Russian Lada demonstrates average market indicators in terms of revenue growth dynamics (plus 28%), Russians spent 229.4 billion rubles on cars of this brand in 10 months.
In terms of financial capacity, companies whose unit sales of cars fell in 2021 are at the same level as last year: in particular, Volkswagen, Mitsubishi and Nissan.
UAZ is in the red at all - for 10 months, Russians spent 12 billion rubles on SUVs and pickups of this brand against 12.4 billion rubles a year earlier.
Against the background of problems with the supply of automotive components and interruptions in production, covering the entire global automotive industry, car companies continue to continuously adjust prices - the same AvtoVAZ increased the cost of Lada models seven times in a year, the last price increase (by 8-10 thousand rubles) occurred at the end of November.
Other automakers regularly rewrite the price tags on their products.
The volume of the automotive market in Russia in monetary terms will continue to increase - in addition to the shortage of cars, inflation, as well as the desire of automakers to recoup past losses, contribute to this, experts say.
In the conditions of a shortage of cars, I think that many automakers were even able to partially pass on to the consumer the costs of previous periods, which they could not include in the price of cars earlier,
says Vladimir Bespalov, an analyst for the automotive industry at VTB Capital.
I believe that in financial terms, automakers are doing very well right now, maintaining high sales margins."
An indirect indicator of this is the growth rate of the cost of cars, which is observed during 2021, the prices of new cars are growing faster than inflation, the expert clarifies.
In the long term, the market will grow both in quantitative terms and in monetary terms, but mainly due to inflation and the complexity of the design of the machines themselves, predicts Bespalov.
With supply increasing, the scope for price increases will be limited.
In monetary terms, the Russian car market will continue to grow next year, even if the growth in the cost of cars slows down, automakers will be able to get their income at the expense of volumes, notes independent consultant on the automotive industry Sergei Burgazliev.
Given the increased demand and insufficient supply, automakers are now trying to get the highest profit from each sold car, Burgazliev notes.
An increase in the production of cars is not expected for at least the next six months, while in Russia the excitement is also fueled by the uncertainty of citizens in the future.
Against the background of the current situation on the market, cars turned out to be a good object for investment - a car bought a year ago, even with mileage, can now be sold for more than the original cost, the expert states.
Biden spoke about the deployment of the US military to Ukraine in the event of a Russian invasion
The US leadership has never considered sending American troops to Ukraine in the event of an "invasion" by Russia.
This statement was made by US President Joe Biden.
"There were never such plans," the head of the White House said, answering a journalist's question about whether the United States had abandoned such an idea.
Biden noted that if the situation around Ukraine escalates, Russia will face economic consequences.
At the same time, he stressed that the United States and NATO have no obligation to use military force to protect Ukraine in the event of escalation.
The American leader also said that the possibility of using American troops unilaterally to defend Ukraine is not on the agenda.
Biden explained that if Russia invades the territory of Ukraine, the United States will redeploy forces to the Eastern European NATO countries (Bulgaria, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, Czech Republic and Estonia).
"We're going to have to put more U.S. and NATO troops on the eastern flank, the B9 - all those NATO countries that we have a solemn obligation to defend against any Russian attack," Biden said.
Earlier, the press secretary of the Russian president, Dmitry Peskov, stressed that Moscow has no intention of invading the territory of Ukraine.
At the same time, he pointed out that Moscow sees a problem in the combat use by Kiev of drones supplied by Turkey, as well as in the fact that "American weapons are approaching our territory."

Promtex-Orient Monolit Combi mattress 16.100x185 cm
The medium-height spring-free Prometex-Orient Monolith Combi 16 mattress is made from alternating layers of natural latex and coconut coir.
One side is medium-hard, the other is moderately hard.
The elegant white jacquard case is quilted with synthetic fabric and has a zipper around the perimeter.
Two types of filler.
The sandwich model consists of eight layers of fillers.
Between the plates of latex, thin plates of coir coconut are laid.
The layered structure of the mattress is characterized by increased wear resistance, durability and resistance to stress.
Natural latex by its characteristics is a dense, elastic, breathable material.
The padding holds its shape and recovers quickly after exertion.
Coconut coir enhances the strength of the product, it naturally has antimicrobial properties.
The combination of these two materials allows you to create a load-resistant orthopedic bed that will serve customers for many years.

The mattress is suitable for people of different body types and ages.

The reverse side of the model is less comfortable for soft tissues, but has more pronounced orthopedic properties.
A moderately hard sleeper is more relevant for those who need to "unload" their back and have a healthy posture.
The mattress is ideal for both a single person and a married couple.
The latter will especially appreciate the presence of a stable surface and the absence of the "wave" effect, when vibrations on one side of the mattress can be transmitted to the opposite side, disturbing a person in a dream.

Set of wool for felting "Assortment No 2" 100% merino, wool 4x10 g.

But now, voila!

For example, you can make a cute toy for yourself or your baby, applications for creativity, jewelry, interior decorations and even clothing and accessories.
Imagine a pair of "dumped" fluffy sheep on your shelf, a small photo frame on the wall, a colorful necklace that will look great with a new dress, or unique slippers that no one will have...
Bring your ideas to life by "rolling up" this wonderful wool!

Alexander Sokurov's pupil's film won the European Oscar for best editing
The Oscar-nominated Russian film "Clenched Fist" won the award of the European Film Academy (it is also called the "European Oscar") in the nomination "Best Editing," reports "Moskovsky Komsomolets."
The competition jury, which voted online due to the difficult epidemiological situation, appreciated the outstanding skill of the filmmakers.
This time, the film by Jasmila Zbanic (Bosnia) "Where are you going, Hades?" received the maximum number of awards.
The main character of the film is a translator at the UN mission, who is trying to save her family during the war in Yugoslavia.
As for the drama "Unclenching Fists," directed by Kira Kovalenko (a graduate of Alexander Sokurov's workshop), this film tells about the complex relationship between a domineering father and those who want to free themselves from paternal guardianship of growing children in North Ossetia.
Earlier it was announced that this film was nominated for an Oscar as the best film shot in a foreign language.

Model "Micropacket Prestige": comfort and natural composition.

Germany: A fourth coronavirus vaccine is imminent
A fourth vaccination will be required in the summer or autumn of 2022.
According to the expert, the current vaccination in Germany will not be final, but will continue with renewed vigour.
Despite an active vaccination campaign in Germany, neither two nor three doses of the coronavirus vaccine will probably be sufficient for full protection.
The head of the Association of General Practitioners, Ulrich Weigeldt, is convinced of this.
This is reported by Die Welt on Saturday, December 11.
"We expect that the fourth vaccination will be required in the summer, at the latest in the autumn," the expert believes.
In addition, Weigeldt hopes that the fourth vaccination against the coronavirus can be carried out "in combination with the influenza vaccination."
This will help to achieve the best results.
In addition, increased vaccination could help combat the spread of the new Omicron coronavirus strain.
Moreover, the new variant is particularly dangerous.
Thus, the likelihood of reinfection with Omicron is three times higher than that of Delta or Beta strains.
This is confirmed by the results of a preliminary study conducted in South Africa.
Based on this, the manufacturers of BioNTech / Pfizer plan to provide a vaccine adapted for Omikron by March 2022.
The companies emphasize that two doses of the vaccine do not provide sufficient protection against infection with the new variant of the coronavirus Omicron.
A study by BioNTech and Pfizer showed that at two doses of the vaccine, the effectiveness is significantly lower: "the neutralizing potential is reduced by more than 25 times."
"This indicates that two doses of BNT162b2 do not provide sufficient protection against infection with the omicron strain," stressed BioNTech and Pfizer.
Therefore, a third dose is necessary.
Experts insist on accelerating the rate of vaccination in the country.
For example, the chairman of the German Society for Infectious Diseases, Bernd Salzberger, advocates shortening the interval between the second and third vaccinations.
Moreover, according to Salzberger, accelerated vaccination will have an impact on the spread of both the delta virus and the omicron variant of the coronavirus.
"Israel's experience shows this very convincingly," the expert stressed.
Wobbler Pontoon21, Bet-A Vib, 54 Silent, 54 mm, 8.5 g
The Bet-A-Vib series is a special branch of the Bet-A family from Pontoon21®.
It (like the Kalikana Vib series) differs from many other vibes in that it was originally designed with ice fishing in mind, not just for casting.
These vibes have a higher specific weight than their similarly sized counterparts, which undoubtedly has a positive effect on the nuances of the use of these interesting lures.
Another recognizable feature is the top fin made of strong and elastic plastic, which creates additional shades of vibration in vertical and horizontal wiring.
As a "winter vibe" when fishing in the swell Bet-A-Vib demonstrates a rather aggressive game.
Often the most catchy is simple monotonous animation, that is, up-and-down movements of the pinnacle almost without pauses.
When planning, the deviation from the vertical axis is not very large, which is convenient when fishing in a limited space, choked with underwater vegetation, snags and other obstacles, which can be hooked.
In addition, a slight deviation is relevant when catching zander and large perch in winter, and especially in the middle of winter, when a point and aggressive bait feed is required.
Having reached the extreme point of the trajectory, Bet-A-Vib instantly turns around and returns to the original vertical.
Bet-A-Vib is also successfully used for winter fishing of pond trout.
To please its whims, you can choose from two modifications: with or without a noise capsule (NS - NanoSound) (SL - Silent).
It is also noted that Bet-A-Vib is able to tease the passive pike, which does not react even to live.
When fishing, Bet-A-Vib demonstrates range and accuracy.
This wobbler is clear and not capricious, it fits well with fishing line and braided cords of even large diameters.
For catching pike, zander, buckwheat or perch, besides uniformly relevant and "step," sometimes with a "chirp" on the bottom.
If you catch in hardened places, you can change the front tee to a double, which will reduce the likelihood of hitches.
Among the lures of its class Bet-A-Vib is among the most stable in operation and, as a result, one of the most catchy.
It can be used with equal success in relatively shallow and rather deep areas.
All models are equipped with Owner ST-36 hooks.

7,000 Russian mercenaries claimed in Libya
There are more than 7,000 mercenaries of the private military company Wagner in Libya.
This was stated on Sunday, December 12, by the Chairman of the Supreme State Council of the Republic Khaled al-Mishri.
"Currently, there are more than 7,000 mercenaries of PMC Wagner in Libya.
They also have airplanes.
They also dig trenches in Sirte and Kufra.
They have 30 jets at Gardabiya airbases (also used as a civilian airport in Sirte)," Anadolu news agency quoted him as saying.
Khaled al-Mishri also pointed out that Russian mercenaries are "trying to take over" the central part of Libya, stretching from Chad to the Mediterranean, after "bringing their man to power" in the Central African Republic.
Save Presence
According to the source, Moscow was looking for a country to maintain its presence in North Africa and "located in Libya."
Wagner has been in Libya since 2019, using an airbase and port in Sirte, as well as an airbase in Jufra, the agency said in a publication.
Russian authorities officially deny that PMC Wagner has the support of the Kremlin.
Where else can there be mercenaries
According to the agency, Wagner is believed to operate in nine countries in Africa - the Central African Republic, Libya, Sudan, Mozambique, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Madagascar, Zimbabwe and Angola.
The company provides military training for local forces, personal protection for leaders and protection of energy facilities.
In exchange for these services, Wagner's subsidiaries receive certain privileges and licenses for the use of minerals and natural resources, as well as for the supply of weapons, technology and military services to these countries," the article reads.
According to the media, the "Wagnerians" allegedly fought in Donbass, Syria, Mozambique, Sudan and the Central African Republic.
This group is not listed in the security agencies or in the register of legal entities, and its fighters are not included in the personnel lists.
This company is under US sanctions.
Earlier, the ambassadors of the 27 EU countries approved restrictions against Wagner.
It is expected that this decision will be approved by the Council of the European Union on December 13.
The situation in Libya
The Supreme State Council of Libya is de facto the second chamber of parliament with advisory functions with Islamists dominating it, writes TASS.
This body has repeatedly called for the postponement of the single day of voting for the election of deputies of the parliament and the head of state from December 24 to at least February 2022.
"The elections are less than two weeks away, and the chances that they will be held on time are rapidly decreasing," the article notes.
Against this background, the Supreme Electoral Commission of Libya has postponed indefinitely the announcement of the final list of candidates, reports Sky News Arabia.
Foreign Policy Through Russian Eyes
38% of Russians see the country's foreign policy as more successes than failures, 29% believe that failures prevail.
"Examples of successes - "in Syria they defended, restored peace there," "the decision on Nord Stream 2," "the whole world was intimidated that cool weapons," "Crimea we pressed."
The main failures are "conflict with Ukraine," "confrontation with Western countries," "isolation from the world," says a study by the Public Opinion Foundation.
The government of Dubai has completely abandoned paperwork - all public services have also become digital only
The government of Dubai has announced the complete abandonment of paperwork and the transition to digital technology.
All public services to the population will also be provided exclusively in electronic form.
This is reported by the Emirati news agency WAM.
"Today marks the beginning of a new phase in the digitalization of all aspects of Dubai life - we have completed the transition to a fully paperless government," Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, the emirate's crown prince and chairman of Dubai's executive council, said on Saturday.
Now, internal and external workflows in all Dubai government agencies will only be carried out digitally through dedicated information platforms.
The innovation affected all sectors without exception: health care, housing and communal services, police, municipal authorities, courts, etc. Many commercial entities also joined the government initiative.
The transition to e-government and document digitization began in Dubai in 2018.
During this time, according to the authorities, 336 million paper sheets were saved, which is 14 million hours of human labor and 353.8 million dollars in monetary value.
Earlier, Moscow Mayor Sergei Sobyanin said that e-services save citizens 2 days a year.

Turkey's automobile production and exports fell below 2020 levels
Turkey's automobile production and exports fell sharply in November as the lira depreciated.
As a result, the industry's 11-month performance was worse than last year's result, Bloomberg reports, citing data from the Turkish Automobile Manufacturers Association.
According to the association, 115 thousand cars were produced from factories in Turkey in November, which is 20% less than a year earlier.
About 75,900 cars were exported, which is more than 25% lower than last year's figure.
And if in the first 10 months of this year, the automotive sector of Turkey showed a positive dynamics to last year, in the 11 months of 2021, the output of cars was already 0.3% worse than last year's figure.
The reason for this fall was the sharp weakening of the Turkish lira, which in November depreciated by 29% against the dollar.
This led to a drop in economic activity in all sectors.
More than 500 SMEs received a deferral of credit payments in 2021
First Deputy Prime Minister Alikhan Smailov spoke about the situation regarding the provision of benefits for small and medium-sized businesses, reports the correspondent of Kazinform.
127 "On approval of the procedure for granting deferred payments on loans of small and medium-sized businesses" was adopted, Alikhan Smailov wrote in his response to the deputy's request.
He recalled that the procedure for granting deferred payments on loans provided for banks and organizations engaged in microfinance activities to provide deferred payments on loans issued before April 1, 2021 to SMEs, including IP, in the period from April 1 to June 30, 2021.
The deferral period ranged from 30 to 90 days at the option of the SME entity.
The borrower's application could specify a different period of deferred payments.
During the period of deferral, the claim work, notification of the need to repay overdue debts, as well as the collection of fees and other payments by the lender were suspended in relation to the borrower," the Deputy Prime Minister noted.
In 2021, second-tier banks received applications for deferral of payments on loans of 603 borrowers-subjects of SMEs, of which 553 SMEs received deferral in the amount of 9.7 billion tenge.
MFIs submitted applications for deferral of 131 SMEs, of which the deferral was granted to 95 entities in the amount of 105.8 million tenge," A. Smailov concluded.
Pulmonologist Puryasev suggested that people with weak immunity are able to easily tolerate the "ocmiron" strain
The doctor suggested that people with weakened immunity can tolerate it more easily than those with a strong protective reaction of the body
Pulmonologist Sergey Puryasev explained why the strain of coronavirus "ocmiron" can be dangerous.
The reason should be sought in the conditions of the origin of the virus.
Scientists believe that "ocmiron" originated in the body of an HIV-infected or immunocompromised person.
That is, when mutated, he encountered no resistance from immunity.
Due to this, he is more aggressive.
Due to the fact that there was no response from immunity, he became very fast.
Apparently, there he has these spike proteins, spikes, maybe more than they should, their antibodies were not cut during mutations, - comments pulmonologist Sergei Puryasev.
The doctor suggested that people with weakened immunity can tolerate "ocmiron" more easily than those who have a strong protective reaction of the body.
It turns out that a strong response of the body to anything, to any infection, is not always good.
In such cases, the body can kill itself.
So it happens in pneumococcal infections, when the young 30-year-old dies, and the old 60-year-olds suffer it in the form of a sneeze.
The immune response is frenzied in the young, it is completely inadequate: where you could only threaten with a finger, it beats like a cannon on sparrows, - concluded Sergey Puryasev.
The doctor also reminded that the coronavirus has dangerous side effects and the most unpleasant of them is pneumonia.
Inflammation of the lungs can be bacterial and viral.
If the first is treated very successfully and quickly, in the second case it is often possible to eliminate only the symptoms - all hope for the body.
The first sign of developing pneumonia will be the beginning of intoxication of the body - it is temperature, weakness, malaise.
Then there are respiratory symptoms: difficulty breathing, throat, cough.
Pain on the right or left, abdominal pain can also indicate a developing problem.
Meanwhile, in Russia, by the end of the year, the younger generation from 12 to 18 years of age may begin to be vaccinated.
Virologist, head of the genomic engineering laboratory of MIPT Pavel Volchkov noted that this category is very actively affected by cow disease.
Teenagers who go to school have the maximum number of contacts.
This is the most socially active stratum, as well as kindergarten students, - said "Moscow 24" Pavel Volchkov, virologist, head of the genomic engineering laboratory of MIPT.
