The Foreign Ministry spoke about the "sad conclusion" in relations between Russia and the United States
Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov, in an interview with Izvestia, assessed the prospects for relations between Moscow and Washington.
He noted that the long way of interaction led to sad conclusions, and the problems between the two countries did not start yesterday.
There is one-sided negative predictability, but in terms of some prospect of improving relations, everything is completely unpredictable.
This is a sad conclusion from the long journey we have come with the current administration, and with Trump, and with Obama.
The problems did not start yesterday," the diplomat pointed out.
According to Ryabkov, the problem is connected with the desire of the United States to impose approaches on Russia on a variety of issues.
The Deputy Foreign Minister added that he would not risk giving optimistic forecasts about the prospects for improving relations and would not expect a change in Washington's position.
He explained that, with the exception of areas such as strategic stability and cybersecurity, there has been no progress.
At the same time, Russia calls on the United States to take a responsible approach in matters of international security and hopes that the signals will be heard and the Americans will heed the arguments of common sense.
Earlier, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, at a meeting with US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken, said that Moscow is ready to restore dialogue with the United States.
Virologist warns of the dangers of vaccinating with a nasal preparation against COVID outside hospitals
Those vaccinated with the nasal vaccine against COVID-19 may develop allergies and need medical attention, so the first points for vaccination with this drug should not be organized at airports and shopping centers.
This was reported to TASS by virologist, corresponding member of the Russian Academy of Sciences, head of the laboratory of bionanotechnology, microbiology and virology of Novosibirsk State University Sergey Netesov.
It is easier to organize nasal vaccination points at airports and shopping centers, but at first I would do it only in medical institutions.
The fact is that there is a possibility of an allergic reaction to such a vaccine, it is small, but it is desirable that the person then sit next to the doctor's office.
Doctors have special sets of anti-allergic drugs that work in just a minute or two, which is sometimes very necessary," Netesov said.
According to the virologist, it will be possible to think about vaccination in shopping centers when experience is gained in using the drug.
He also emphasized that when using a nasal vaccine, it is important that it gets on the mucous membrane in the nasal cavity.
At the same time, there is a possibility that the vaccine will not reach its destination if the person vaccinated with nasal congestion blows his nose after injection.

Serbia produced 2 million doses of Sputnik V vaccine
The Sputnik V vaccine is the most popular in Serbia.
Serbia has produced about 2 million doses of the Russian Sputnik V vaccine, Nenad Popovich, the country's Minister of Innovation and Technological Development, told TASS.
"The Torlak State Institute has so far produced about 2 million doses of the Sputnik V vaccine, and we expect that at least 4 million will be produced in the coming period," Popovich stated.
According to him, the Russian vaccine is the most popular among the Serbs.
In this regard, the republic plans to make an additional purchase of a million doses of vaccine from Russia.
The Minister of Innovation and Technological Development of Serbia also expressed interest in the production of the Sputnik V nasal vaccine and the Sputnik Light drug on the territory of the state.
Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin said that the Russian Federation had delivered almost two million doses of domestic vaccine against coronavirus infection Sputnik V to Serbia.

Mattress Benartti Prime Orto S1000 145x190.
Mattress Prime Orto S1000 with different sides of firmness, total mattress height 22 cm.
The maximum allowable load per bed is up to 150 kg.
The basis of the mattress is an independent spring block "S1000" (1000 springs per bed).
Each spring is in a separate fabric pocket, which allows the springs to properly distribute the load on the body.
For additional protection of the spring block, an insulating layer of felt is added to separate the fillings of the mattress and springs.
On one side of the mattress there is a layer of coconut coir 3 cm high, which gives additional rigidity and durability to the mattress.
On the opposite side of the mattress, a layer of coconut coir 3 cm and natural latex 1 cm is added.
Natural latex has an anatomical effect and wear-resistant properties.
The mattress cover is made of cotton jacquard quilted on environmentally friendly material Hollcon.
The fabric is treated with special antibacterial impregnation Sanitized (Sweden).
Impregnation ensures the complete destruction of mold fungi, does not allow microorganisms, dust mites and microbes to develop.
The mattress is equipped with four convenient handles for turning over, as well as aerators for additional ventilation of the mattress layers.
The mattress along the perimeter is additionally reinforced with an artificial latex frame, which significantly increases its service life.

In the UK, 1239 cases of omicron-strain of coronavirus were recorded per day - RT Russian
In the UK, 1239 cases of infection with a new omicron strain of coronavirus were detected per day.
This is reported by Sky News.
In particular, 1196 new cases of the Omicron strain were recorded in England, 38 people fell ill with a new type of infection in Scotland and five in Northern Ireland.
The total number of cases of COVID-19 from a new strain in the UK has reached 3137 people.
Earlier, scientists at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, in a pessimistic forecast, calculated that 75,000 people could die in England by April due to an outbreak of coronavirus caused by the Omicron strain.

New Caledonians reject idea of independence from France
According to the final results of the third referendum on the independence of New Caledonia, the vast majority of participants refused to leave France.
This was announced on December 12 by the French TV channel BFM.TV.
96.5% of those who voted were against independence.
Supported independence from France 3.51% of the inhabitants of the archipelago in the South Pacific.
The results of 2.99% of the ballots were annulled.
The level of participation in voting that day was very low: about 55% of the inhabitants of the archipelago came to the polling stations.
According to experts, the low turnout is due to calls by separatists to refuse to participate in the referendum due to the coronavirus.
Paris refused to postpone the date of the referendum.
In October 2020, New Caledonians voted against independence from France in a referendum.
In 2018, the region already held a referendum on independence.
Most of the residents supported the presence of the archipelago in France.
New Caledonia is located almost 20 thousand kilometers from mainland France.
In 1853, France claimed New Caledonia as its own.
About 270 thousand people live in the archipelago, the territory is endowed with a special administrative-territorial status.
There is a 1998 agreement between Paris and the administration of New Caledonia, according to which the region can organize a vote on its independence twice with a difference of two years.

WHO tentatively considers "omicron" less dangerous than "delta"
The World Health Organization (WHO) tentatively believes that "omicron" is less dangerous than the delta strain of coronavirus.
At the same time, there is evidence of a decrease in the effectiveness of vaccines in case of a disease with a new variant of COVID-19.
As of December 9, Omicron is registered in 63 countries.
"Preliminary data and a significantly altered protein antigenic profile of the Omicron strain suggest reduced vaccine effectiveness against infection and transmission of the variant.
According to preliminary findings from South Africa, it is assumed that it ("severity of the disease" - ed.) may be less severe than with "delta"," the WHO technical report says.
The organization notes that so far all reported cases of omicron infection in the EU are mild or asymptomatic.
At the same time, the new strain, according to preliminary data, is spreading faster than the delta.
Two cases of infection with the omicron strain have been registered in Russia.
They "were previously immunized," the Gamaleya Center said.
The head of Rospotrebnadzor, Anna Popova, said that there is still no reliable evidence that the new variant of the coronavirus is less dangerous than the rest.

Four scenarios for Zelensky named in Ukraine
Former deputy of the Verkhovna Rada Vadim Denisenko listed four options for the development of events for the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky in 2022.
In his opinion, the head of state may be left without the support of the West, and may also make compromises on Donbass.
On Sunday, December 12, Denisenko told in a publication on the Glavred portal.
The first option, which Denisenko called the "perfect storm," assumes that key Western countries will no longer support Ukraine, having reached an agreement on the future of the country without its participation.
This development will contribute to a deep crisis that Kyiv may face in 2023.
"At the same time, there is a decrease in prices for key goods that we traditionally export <...> internal protests and confrontation between the authorities and key FIGs (financial and industrial groups. - Ed.)," the ex-MP added.
According to Denisenko, there is another scenario for the development of the situation - "a war against everyone."
This forecast will come true in the event of high turbulence in world politics, in which the Ukrainian authorities will face a number of problems.
Because of this state of affairs, the leadership of Ukraine may make compromises on Donbass, as a result of which confrontation within the country is possible.
At the end of summer, Zelensky's position will weaken, the probability of such a situation, according to the former people's deputy, is up to 50-55%.
The third option for the development of the situation in Ukrainian politics is a confrontation between groups of the population and the president who disagree with Zelensky, which is why it is likely to seize control of the power bloc and implement "populist initiatives."
During this version of the crisis, Zelensky will begin "reformatting power," Denisenko added.
Another scenario is the transformation of Zelensky into the "father of the nation."
This can lead to some event that will be a strong shock to society.
"The event should be large enough to provoke a reaction from external partners and lead to an increase in support for Ukraine," Denisenko said.
This version of the development of the situation is possible as a result of a natural disaster, a man-made disaster or Russia's aggressive actions, the ex-deputy believes.
At the same time, the Russian side has more than once rejected any possibility of an "attack" on Ukraine.
Moscow noted that it is the Ukrainian authorities, NATO and the United States that are increasing military activity near the Russian borders.
Earlier, on November 11, data from a survey by the Rating sociological group showed that the rating of the Ukrainian president fell to record lows, amounting to 19.3%.
This is the lowest figure since his election as head of state.
Analysts predicted a situation in which, in the event of the next presidential elections in Ukraine, only 21.8% would vote for Zelensky, while 14.5% would vote for the ex-president of the country Petro Poroshenko.
At the same time, only 19.3% of respondents expressed support for the president.

The Beautyson Sense Hard S600 mini Sint mattress has a compact texture, comfortable elasticity and rigidity, wear resistance and durability properties.
The product of the brand "Beautyson" from the "Sens" series is intended for a healthy sleep for people suffering from diseases of the joints and the vascular system.
The design ensures uniform distribution of the load over the surface and a pronounced comfortable effect.
The basis of the mattress Buttison Sens Hard S600 mini Sint is an independent spring block S600 mini with a reduced height of the springs.
Beautyson uses spunbond, coconut coir and polyurethane foam as internal fillers.
Spunbond serves as an intermediate insulating layer between soft materials and springs.
Orthopedic foam with carbon impregnation is decorated on the surface with figured cutting, which provides a micro-massage effect.
Coconut coir is a hypoallergenic material that gives the mattress high moisture exchange and breathability characteristics.
The outer case for the mattress is made of dense jacquard with synthetic fibers.
The material is strong and durable, does not wear out and does not require complex maintenance.
A poet arrested for a campaign on Red Square: "They give 10 days for a quote from Yevtushenko, here it is, the power of poetry!"
At the beginning of the week, the 21-year-old poet Alexander Volchenkov was arrested for ten days.
A HSE student was detained on Red Square with a poster with the hashtag #a poet in Russia is more than a poet.
This quote belongs to the writer Yevgeny Yevtushenko.
A protocol was drawn up against Alexander under an administrative article on repeated violation of the procedure for holding a public action.
The first time he was detained on January 23 at Pushkin Square, at a rally in support of Alexei Navalny.
"The goal was to draw attention to poetry in general, now interest in it, unfortunately, has been lost, to the decline of the common culture in Russia and also a small hope to inspire unknown poets to write their poems on the Internet under this hashtag," Alexander explains.
We contacted the young poet to find out the circumstances of the detention and reveal the message of his message in more detail.
How did the police treat you during your arrest this time and before?
What did you ask in the department, how did you comment on your action?
This time, the employees were more correct, the detention was maximum, polite, no matter how ridiculous it may sound in some context of the word.
On Pushkinskaya, riot police took and took hard.
Asked standardly, about motives.
When they heard, in principle, they looked, if not approvingly, then understandingly.
With the exception of the monkey house blown on all 4 sides, everything was extremely correct, but I knew what I was doing.
And if, after the action, under this hashtag, at least a few people start writing their own poems, I will not spend these 10 days in vain.

Researchers reveal how potatoes help fight age-related disorders
The study showed that potatoes are rich in vitamins and minerals that help improve blood circulation and lower cholesterol levels.
The root contains B vitamins, vitamin C, phosphorus, potassium, magnesium, riboflavin, folic and pantothenic acids.
All these elements help the body's systems to function.
In addition, potatoes help in the fight against age-related disorders.
Due to the high content of fiber, it is good for the gastrointestinal tract, and with regular use, it can also help in the prevention of hypertension and atherosclerosis.
However, for the greatest benefit, the root crop is better stewed or boiled rather than fried in oil.
Earlier, The Daily Express warned that potatoes can be dangerous for diabetics, like other foods with a high glycemic index.
These are carbohydrate foods that quickly break down into sugars, such as sugar, sugary soft drinks, white rice, and white bread.
In early December, the Kommersant newspaper warned of a possible shortage of Russian table potatoes, noting a reduction in its production in private farms and an increase in processing capacity.
According to market participants, the shortage of products at the moment can only be replaced by imports.
Lostfilm, lordfilm and other pirates will be removed from the issuance of "Yandex"
Relegation candidates
In 2015, the rights holders from the RAEC/Media cluster compiled a list of the 100 largest pirate sites on the Runet, and most of them ceased to exist, says Karen Kazaryan, director general of the Internet Research Institute.
But some - Kinogo, Lostfilm, Filmix - still managed to survive thanks, among other things, to regular domain name changes, he adds.
For example, on Lostfilm, which is available in the search results of both Yandex and Google, you can watch pirated copies of the Netflix series "The Squid Game" and "Tenderness" directed by Anna Melikyan - the original series of ivi, Russia's largest video service (part of AIV).
On Kinogo, which is also available in the search engine results, you can watch the animated novelty "Encanto," but judging by the quality of the video, this is the so-called screen (a pirated copy of the film shot in the cinema).
On Filmix, which can also be found through search engines, the series "Univer. 10 Years Later" by the TNT channel (part of Gazprom-Media) is available.

Mattress Dimax Micro Ultimate, size 160x190
Orthopedic spring mattress Micro Ultimate.
The model is convenient in that it has two surfaces that are different in terms of softness - high rigidity and slightly more than average.
The composition of the product includes only high-quality and premium fillers, which have proven themselves exclusively from the best side.
Springs: in the center of the model there is a block of independent springs "micropackage."
This means that there are 2000 spirals per bed, which work completely autonomously.
It is their functioning that gives a unique point adjustment.
"Micropackage" is the highest frequency of the entire variety of spring blocks "Dimaks", so it has a pronounced orthopedic effect and is considered premium.
Fillers: combinations of coir and natural latex layers are installed above and below the springs.
The only difference is the order of the plates.
If one surface has latex, then the other has coconut coir.
Such a tandem of fillers has long been a classic, since it transfers to the mattress not only orthopedic, but also anatomical properties.
If the coir provides proper back support, then the latex gives the adaptation of the surface to the human body.
Cover: The model comes in a quilted Aloe Vera knitted cover.
At the request of the client, it can be made both removable and stationary.
The total height of the product is 27 cm, the recommended load per bed is 170 kg.
Warranty and safety: the warranty period is 3 years.
The mattress has received all the necessary certificates and documents that confirm its complete safety and reliability in operation.
The orthopedic foam used in the mattress is CertiPUR certified.
Estonian scientists will look for life on Venus
The Massachusetts Institute of Technology, in cooperation with the Tartu Observatory and other research institutions and companies, is preparing three space missions to Venus to search for signs of life in the atmosphere, Actual Camera reported on Sunday.
The goal of the missions starting in five years is to assess the habitability of the clouds of Venus, and then search for life there.
For the project, scientists from Tartu have proposed tools for measuring the acidity and oxygen content in the clouds of Venus.
Until now, it has been assumed that the clouds of Venus, the planet closest to Earth, are too acidic for life to exist there, but Venus was probably originally an Earth-like planet.
During the third mission, a sample from Venus should arrive.
Suppose that if we find life there, then the main question will be whether it is similar to Earth or different.
If it is very similar, then it will be obvious that earthly life did not begin on Earth.
If it is different, then perhaps it will be more likely that life originated on Earth," said Mihkel Pajusalu, head of the Estonian team of the Venus Life Finder project.

Metaverses will change Russian business
The topic of the metaverses became popular this fall when Mark Zuckerberg announced the transformation of Facebook into Meta.
For the market, this event was an important signal: the largest player confirmed the development of a new format of digital interaction between people.
This means that businesses in Russia, as well as all over the world, will invest in the creation of their own metauniverses and their subsequent monetization.
Metaverses should be considered as a continuation of objectively existing trends.
On the one hand, the trend to create remote interactions in a pandemic, because people are tired of separation and restrictions.
On the other hand, this is a consequence of the desire of business to develop ecosystems and adapt operating models for them.
With the third - they are a logical continuation of the asset digitalization trend, when any rights, securities, works of art and even money are transferred to a digital format.

The British economist was unable to provide a forecast for 2022
British economist Jim O'Neill was unable to provide a forecast for 2022, because, in his opinion, such attempts will turn into a failure.
He wrote about this in an article for Project Syndicate.
The expert believes that next year will be full of unpredictability and any trend can change the turnover.
The coronavirus pandemic remains the most important factor, followed by inflation, he said.
O'Neill also admitted that he does not know whether the increase in commodity prices is temporary or not.
As the specialist pointed out, even before the pandemic, it was clear that "the world of endless generosity of central banks has already outlived itself" and it is time to return to a relationship where interest rates adjusted for inflation will correlate with expected GDP growth rates.
O'Neill noted that, against the backdrop of the pandemic, the continuation of ultra-soft economic policy could, according to some experts, lead to a new surge in inflation.
In addition, attention should be paid to the issue of productivity growth, as well as increasing poverty and climate change, O'Neill concluded.
Earlier, the head of the global research department at Otkrytie Investments, Mikhail Shulgin, said that positive expectations for the dollar exchange rate for 2022 remain, while the growth potential will be less significant.
Among the risks to the dollar, Shulgin named the Fed's monetary policy, oil price dynamics and fears amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Car mats EVA (rhombus) for Hyundai Tucson I (2004-2010).
EVA car mats are made of high-quality Russian-made material.
The surface of the rugs consists of diamond-shaped cells.
The thickness of the mats is 10 mm, the depth of the cells is 5-6 mm.
Rugs do not absorb and do not pass moisture.
All dirt is evenly distributed over the cells, keeping the surface clean.
The material from which the rugs are made is elastic, wear-resistant, odorless.
Maintains its properties in the temperature range from -50 to 50 °C.
Rugs are unpretentious in operation and are suitable for year-round use.
EVA car mats cover the regular carpet as much as possible, closing the area for resting the left foot.
The rear row tunnel is covered with a rug.
The edging is made of a heavy-duty automobile sling.
Mattress Dimax Practitioner Basis Plus B13 180x220 cm
Springless mattress Dimax (Dimaks) Practitioner Basis Plus v13 consists of a single type of filler.
This is a 13 cm high artificial latex slab.
Due to the characteristics of the material, the mattress has a symmetrical average stiffness of the sides.
The product is covered with a jacquard cover with quilting on a comfort layer, removable or non-removable type to choose from.
PPU is a hygienic material with anatomical properties.
The main advantages of artificial latex (PPU) are characteristics similar to the natural analogue, but at a lower cost.
Artificial latex is resilient and elastic, but, unlike natural material, has greater rigidity.
It forms an anatomical surface of the mattress with high-quality support, which ensures a comfortable sleep.
The material is well ventilated, does not accumulate moisture and does not cause allergic reactions.
The strength of this filler ensures the durability and wear resistance of the mattress.
A quality mattress that is not afraid of temperature changes.
Anatomical, inexpensive and resistant to temperature changes, this mattress is ideal for arranging a bed in the country or in a country house.
Its advantages also include universal medium firmness and a maximum load of up to 100 kg, which makes this mattress suitable for most categories of users.
Russians gave car dealers about 4.5% of the country's GDP
According to the results of 10 months of 2021, Russians spent 2 trillion 784 billion rubles on the purchase of new cars, which is 28% more than in the same period last year, according to statistics from the Russian Automotive Market Research (NAPI) agency.
To understand the scale, approximately the same amount (about 3 trillion rubles) was spent by the state to support citizens and the economy during the coronavirus pandemic.
Last September, at a meeting of the heads of state of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, President Vladimir Putin said that this amount is comparable to more than 4.5% of the country's gross domestic product (GDP) for 2020.
In terms of revenue in the Russian market, the Korean brand Kia is the leader.
For 10 months of this year, he managed to sell cars worth 325.7 billion rubles, which is almost 24% more than a year earlier.
Kia's sister brand Hyundai has even more significant growth - more than 35%, and revenue from the sale of cars is estimated at 279.3 billion rubles.
In the leading positions, this brand also increased the weighted average price of a car - during the year at Hyundai it grew by almost 21%, to 1.94 million rubles - only Changan, Chery, Geely and Mercedes-Benz had a stronger dynamics of price increase.
At the same time, sales volumes of Korean brands did not grow so significantly: according to the statistics of the Automobile Manufacturers Committee of the Association of European Businesses in Russia, in quantitative terms, Kia sold 9.4% more cars over the same period than a year earlier.
Hyundai - by almost 12%.
Japanese Toyota closes the top three in terms of sales in monetary terms - Russians spent 275.5 billion rubles on cars of this brand in 10 months, which is 14% more than a year earlier.
The Japanese are followed by Mercedes-Benz with an indicator of 266.1 billion rubles (+75%) - the German premium brand increased both sales volume (by 37%) and the weighted average price of a car (almost 28%, to 8.2 million rubles).
"Mercedes-Benz is simultaneously seeing good growth in sales and the weighted average price - more, for example, than BMW - hence the greater growth in financial capacity," explained Tatiana Arabadzhi, General Director of NAPI.
In terms of sales growth rates, Chinese brands are showing fantastic results, which also significantly increased their financial capacity this year."
The Russian Lada in terms of income growth dynamics demonstrates average market indicators (plus 28%), Russians spent 229.4 billion rubles on cars of this brand in 10 months.
At the level of last year in terms of financial capacity, there are companies whose car sales in pieces fell in 2021: in particular, Volkswagen, Mitsubishi and Nissan.
UAZ is completely in the red - for 10 months, the Russians spent 12 billion rubles on SUVs and pickups of this brand against 12.4 billion rubles a year earlier.
Against the backdrop of problems with the supply of auto components and interruptions in production that have engulfed the entire global auto industry, auto companies continue to continuously adjust prices - the same AvtoVAZ increased the cost of Lada models seven times a year, the last increase in price (by 8-10 thousand rubles) occurred at the end of November.
Regularly rewrite the price tags for their products and other automakers.
The volume of the Russian automotive market in monetary terms will continue to increase - in addition to the shortage of cars, inflation also contributes to this, as well as the desire of automakers to win back past losses, experts say.
In the context of a shortage of cars, I think that many automakers were even able to partially pass on to the consumer the costs of past periods that they could not include in the price of cars earlier,
says Vladimir Bespalov, an auto industry analyst at VTB Capital. -
I believe that financially, automakers are doing very well now, maintaining high sales margins."
An indirect indicator of this is the rate of growth in the cost of cars that are observed during 2021, the prices of new cars are growing faster than inflation, the expert specifies.
In the long term, the market will grow both in quantitative terms and in monetary terms, but mainly due to inflation and the complexity of the design of the machines themselves, Bespalov predicts.
As supply increases, the scope for price increases will be limited.
In monetary terms, the Russian car market will continue to grow next year, even if the growth in the cost of cars slows down, automakers will be able to earn their income from volumes, says Sergei Burgazliev, an independent automotive industry consultant.
Given increased demand and insufficient supply, automakers are now looking to make the most profit from every car sold, Burgazliev said. -
An increase in the production of cars is not expected for at least the next six months, while in Russia the excitement is also fueled by the uncertainty of citizens in the future.
Against the backdrop of the current market situation, cars turned out to be a good investment object - a car bought a year ago, even with mileage, can now be sold for more than its original cost, the expert states.
Biden spoke about the transfer of the US military to Ukraine in the event of a Russian invasion
The US leadership has never considered sending US troops to Ukraine in the event of a Russian "invasion".
This statement was made by US President Joe Biden.
"There have never been such plans," the head of the White House said, answering a journalist's question about whether the United States abandoned such an idea.
Biden noted that in the event of an escalation of the situation around Ukraine, Russia will face economic consequences.
At the same time, he stressed that the United States and NATO have no obligation to use military force to protect Ukraine in the event of an escalation.
The American leader also said that the possibility of using American troops unilaterally for the defense of Ukraine is not on the agenda.
Biden explained that if Russia invades the territory of Ukraine, the United States will transfer forces to the Eastern European NATO countries (Bulgaria, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, the Czech Republic and Estonia).
"We will have to send more US and NATO troops to the eastern flank, B9 - all those NATO countries for which we have a sacred obligation to protect them from any attack from Russia," Biden said.
Earlier, the press secretary of the President of Russia Dmitry Peskov stressed that Moscow has no intentions to invade the territory of Ukraine.
At the same time, he pointed out that Moscow sees a problem in the combat use of drones supplied by Turkey by Kyiv, and also in the fact that "American weapons are approaching our territory."

Medium height springless construction mattress Promtex-Orient Monolith Combi 16 is made of alternating layers of natural latex and coconut coir.
One side is medium hard, the other is moderately hard.

The filler keeps its shape and quickly recovers after stress.
Coconut coir enhances the strength of the product, naturally has antimicrobial properties.
The combination of these two materials allows you to create a load-resistant orthopedic bed that will serve customers for many years.

The mattress is suitable for people of different body types and ages.
The medium-hard surface is versatile with a balanced combination of orthopedics and comfort.
The reverse side of the model is less comfortable for soft tissues, but has more pronounced orthopedic properties.
A moderately hard bed is more relevant for those who need to "unload" their backs and have a healthy posture.
The mattress is ideal for both a single person and a couple.
The latter will especially appreciate the presence of a stable surface and the absence of the "wave" effect, when fluctuations on one side of the mattress can be transmitted to the opposite side, disturbing a person in a dream.

The film of the student of Alexander Sokurov received the European "Oscar" for the best editing
The Oscar-nominated Russian film Unclenching Fists won the European Film Academy (also known as the European Oscar) award for Best Editing, according to Moskovsky Komsomolets.
The jury of the competition, which voted online due to the difficult epidemiological situation, appreciated the outstanding skill of the filmmakers.
The maximum number of awards was received this time by the film by Yasmila Zbanich (Bosnia) "Where are you going, Aida?"
The main character of the tape is a translator at the UN mission, who is trying to save her family during the war in Yugoslavia.
As for the drama "Unclenching Fists," filmed by Kira Kovalenko (a graduate of Alexander Sokurov's workshop), this film tells about the difficult relationship between an imperious father and those who want to free themselves from paternal guardianship of growing children in North Ossetia.
It was previously announced that the film was nominated for an Oscar as Best Foreign Language Film.

Germany: Fourth coronavirus vaccination is inevitable
A fourth vaccination will be required in the summer or fall of 2022.
According to the expert, the current vaccination in Germany will not be the final vaccination, but will continue with renewed vigor.
Despite an active vaccination campaign in Germany, neither two nor three doses of the coronavirus vaccine will probably be sufficient for complete protection.
The head of the Association of General Practitioners, Ulrich Weigeldt, is convinced of this.
Die Welt reported this on Saturday, December 11.
"We expect that a fourth vaccination will be required in the summer, at the latest in the fall," the expert believes.
In addition, Weigeldt hopes that the fourth coronavirus vaccination can be given "in combination with flu vaccination."
This would help to achieve the best results.
In addition, increased vaccination could help fight the spread of the new Omicron strain of coronavirus.
And the new variant is especially dangerous.
For example, Omicron is three times more likely to be reinfected than Delta or Beta strains.
This is evidenced by the results of a preliminary study conducted in South Africa.
On this basis, the manufacturers of BioNTech / Pfizer plan to provide a vaccine adapted to Omikron by March 2022.
The companies emphasize that two doses of the vaccine do not provide sufficient protection against infection with the new variant of the Omikron coronavirus.
A study by BioNTech and Pfizer found that with two doses of the vaccine, the efficacy is significantly lower: "the neutralizing potential is reduced by more than 25 times."
"This indicates that two doses of BNT162b2 do not provide sufficient protection against infection with the Omicron strain," BioNTech and Pfizer stressed.
Therefore, a third dose is needed.
Experts insist on accelerating the pace of vaccination in the country.
For example, Bernd Salzberger, chairman of the German Infectious Diseases Society, advocates shortening the interval between the second and third vaccinations.
Moreover, according to Salzberger, accelerated vaccination will have an impact on the spread of both the delta virus and the omicron variant of coronavirus.
"Israel's experience shows this very convincingly," the expert stressed.
Pontoon21 wobbler, Bet-A Vib, 54 Silent, 54 mm, 8.5 g.
The Bet-A-Vib series is a special branch of the Bet-A family from Pontoon21®.
It (like the Kalikana Vib series) differs from many other vibs in that it was originally designed with ice fishing in mind, not just backcountry fishing.
These wibs have a higher specific weight than similar in size analogues, which, of course, has a positive effect on the nuances of the application of these interesting baits.
Another recognizable feature - the upper fin of durable and resilient plastic, which creates additional shades of vibration in the vertical and horizontal wiring.
As a "winter vib" in plumb fishing the Bet-A-Vib shows quite an aggressive game.
Often the most catchable is a simple monotonous animation, that is movement of the rod up and down almost without pauses.
When planning the deviation from the vertical axis is not very large, which is useful when fishing in a confined space, cluttered with underwater vegetation, snags and other obstacles, which can catch.
In addition, a small deviation is relevant when fishing for pikeperch and large perch in winter, and especially in the middle of winter, when you want point and aggressive serving of bait.
Upon reaching the extreme point of the trajectory, Bet-A-Vib instantly turns around and returns to the original vertical.
Bet-A-Vib is also successfully used for winter fishing of pond trout.
To please its whims, you can choose from two modifications: with sound capsule (NS - NanoSound) or without it (SL - Silent).
Also it was noticed that Bet-A-Vib could irritate passive pike, which don't even react to live bait.
When fishing back cast Bet-A-Vib shows range and accuracy.
This wobbler is understandable and not capricious, it combines well with fishing line and braided lines even of big diameters.
For fishing back casts of pike, pikeperch, ruffe or perch in addition to uniform is relevant and "step", sometimes with "chirping" on the bottom.
If you catch in a rucked place, you can change the front tee for a double, which reduces the likelihood of snagging.
Among the baits of its class Bet-A-Vib among the most stable in operation and, consequently, one of the most catchable.
With equal success can be used on both relatively shallow and fairly deep areas.
All models are equipped with Owner ST-36 hooks.

In Libya they claimed about 7 thousand Russian mercenaries
There are more than 7 thousand mercenaries of the private military company (PMC) "Wagner" in Libya.
This was announced on Sunday, December 12, by the chairman of the Supreme State Council of the Republic, Khaled al-Mishri.
"There are currently more than 7,000 mercenaries of the Wagner PMC in Libya.
They have aircraft as well.
They are also digging trenches in Sirte and Kufra.
They have 30 jets at Gardabiya air base (also used as a civilian airport in Sirte)," Anadolu agency quotes him.
Khaled al-Mishri also indicated that Russian mercenaries are "trying to seize" the central part of Libya, stretching from Chad to the Mediterranean Sea, after "bringing their man to power" in the Central African Republic.
Maintaining a presence
According to the interlocutor, Moscow was looking for a country to maintain its presence in North Africa and "has located itself in Libya.
"Wagner has been in Libya since 2019, using an air base and port in Sirte as well as an air base in Jufra, the agency's publication noted.
Russian authorities have officially denied that the Wagner PMC is supported by the Kremlin.
Where else there may be mercenaries
According to the agency, "Wagner" allegedly operates in nine countries in Africa - CAR, Libya, Sudan, Mozambique, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Madagascar, Zimbabwe and Angola.
The company provides military training for local forces, personal protection for leaders and protection of energy facilities.
In exchange for these services, Wagner subsidiaries receive certain privileges and licenses to use minerals and natural resources, as well as to supply arms, technology and military services to these countries," the article said.
According to the media, the "Wagnerites" allegedly fought in Donbass, Syria, Mozambique, Sudan and the Central African Republic.
This group is listed neither in the law enforcement agencies, nor in the registry of legal entities, and its fighters are absent from the personnel lists.
This company is under U.S. sanctions.
Recall that earlier the postpresidents of the 27 EU countries approved restrictions against Wagner.
The Council of the European Union is expected to approve this decision on December 13.
Situation in Libya
Libya's Supreme State Council is a de facto second chamber of the parliament with an advisory function and dominated by Islamists, TASS writes.
The body has repeatedly called for the postponement of a single day of voting for the election of members of parliament and the head of state from December 24 to at least February 2022.
"There are less than two weeks until the elections, and the chances that they will be held on time are rapidly decreasing," the material notes.
Against this background, Libya's High Electoral Commission has indefinitely postponed the announcement of the final list of candidates, Sky News Arabia reports.
Foreign policy as seen by the Russians
38% of Russians see more successes than failures in the country's foreign policy, while 29% believe that failures prevail.
"Examples of successes are "we defended in Syria, restored peace there," "the decision on Nord Stream-2," "the whole world was intimidated that cool weapons," and "we reclaimed the Crimea."
The main failures are "conflict with Ukraine," "confrontation with Western countries," and "isolation from the world," according to a study by the Public Opinion Foundation.
Dubai government has completely abandoned paperwork - all government services have also become digital only
Dubai government announced a complete move away from paperwork and towards digital technologies.
All public services will also be rendered only electronically.
This was reported by the Emirati news agency WAM.
"Today marks the beginning of a new phase in the digitalization of all aspects of Dubai - we have completed the transition to a completely paperless government," said Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Chairman of Dubai's Executive Council, on Saturday.
Internal and external document flow in all government agencies in Dubai will now only be done digitally through dedicated IT platforms.
The innovation has affected all sectors without exception: health, housing, police, municipalities, courts, etc. Many commercial entities also joined the government's initiative.
The transition to e-government and digitalization of documents began in Dubai in 2018.
During this time, authorities have calculated that 336 million pieces of paper were saved, which amounts to 14 million hours of human labor and 353.8 million dollars in monetary terms.
Earlier, the mayor of Moscow Sergey Sobyanin said that electronic services save citizens 2 days a year.

Turkey's auto production and exports fell below 2020 levels
Turkey's auto production and exports fell sharply in November amid a depreciating lira.
As a result, the industry's 11-month performance was worse than last year's result, Bloomberg reported, citing data from the Turkish Automobile Manufacturers Association.
According to Association, 115 thousand cars were let out from factories in November in Turkey that is 20% less than year before.
About 75.9 thousand cars were sent for export, which is more than 25% less than last year's figure.
While the first 10 months of the year saw a positive trend in Turkey's auto sector compared to the same period last year, the first 11 months of 2021 saw a 0.3% decline in vehicle production compared to the same period last year.
The reason for such a fall was the sharp weakening of the Turkish lira, which fell in November by 29% against the dollar.
This led to a drop in economic activity in all sectors.
More than 500 SMEs got credit deferral in 2021
First Deputy Prime Minister Alikhan Smailov told about the situation with the provision of benefits for small and medium businesses, reports the correspondent of MIA "Kazinform".
"According to the information of the Agency of the Republic of Kazakhstan on Regulation and Development of Financial Market, this year in execution of the order of the Head of State from April 1, 2021 adopted the order of the Chairman of the Agency from April 9, 2021 № 127 "On approval of the order of deferral of payments on loans to small and medium business," - wrote in his response to the deputy request Alikhan Smailov.
He reminded that the order of granting deferment of payments on loans implied granting by banks and organizations implementing microfinance activity the deferment of payments on loans granted till April 1, 2021 to SMEs, including private entrepreneurs during the period from April 1 till June 30, 2021.
The term of the deferment ranged from 30 to 90 days at the choice of SMEs.
In the application of the borrower could have specified a different period of deferral of payments.
During the period of deferment in respect of the borrower were suspended claim and enforcement work, notification of the need for repayment of arrears, as well as collection of commissions and other payments by the lender, "- said the deputy prime minister.
During 2021 the second-tier banks received requests for deferral of payments on loans to 603 borrowers SMEs, of which 553 SMEs received deferral for the amount of 9.7 billion tenge.
Applications for deferment were filed to MFIs by 131 SMEs and 95 of them were given delays to the amount of 105,8 mln tenge," A. Smailov concluded.
Pulmonologist Puryasev suggested that people with weak immunity can easily tolerate the strain of "ocmiron"
The doctor suggested that people with weakened immunity can tolerate it more easily than those with a strong body defense reaction
Pulmonologist Sergei Puryasev explained why the strain of coronavirus "oxymyron" may be dangerous.
The reason should be sought in the conditions of origin of the virus.
Scientists believe that "oxymyron" originated in the body of an HIV-infected or immunodeficient person.
That is, when it mutated, it met no resistance from the immune system.
Due to this, it is more aggressive.
Due to the fact that there was no response from the immune system, he became very fast.
Apparently, there may be more of these spike proteins than there should be, because their antibodies were not cut down during the mutations," commented pulmonologist Sergei Purjasev.
The doctor suggested that people with weakened immune system may tolerate the "ocmiron" more easily than those with a strong defense reaction of the body.
It turns out that a strong body response to anything, to any infection, is not always a good thing.
In such cases, the body can kill itself.
This is how it happens with pneumococcal infections, when young people in their 30s die and old people in their 60s sneeze to death.
The immune response is rabid in young people, it is completely inadequate: where you could only wag a finger, it hits like a cannon on a sparrow, - concluded Sergey Purjasev.
The doctor also reminded that coronavirus has dangerous side effects and the most unpleasant of them is pneumonia.
Lung inflammation can be bacterial or viral.
If the first is treated very successfully and quickly, in the second case you can often only buy the symptoms - all hope is on the body.
The first sign of developing pneumonia will be the beginning of intoxication of the body - this temperature, weakness, malaise.
Then come respiratory symptoms: difficulty breathing, throat scratch, cough.
Pains on the right or left side, abdominal pains could also indicate a developing problem.
Meanwhile, Russia may start vaccinating the younger generation from 12 to 18 years old by the end of the year.
Pavel Volchkov, a virologist and head of the laboratory of genomic engineering at MIPT, noted that this category is very actively affected by covid.
Teenagers who go to school have the maximum number of contacts.
This is the most socially active stratum, as well as kindergarten students," Pavel Volchkov, virologist and head of the Laboratory of Genomic Engineering at MIPT, told Moscow 24.

Immunologists hypothesize why obese people fall victim to covid
The authors of the paper studied adipose tissue left over from bariatric surgeries and found that fat cells known as adipocytes can become infected with the coronavirus.
Immune cells located in adipose tissue, macrophages, also became infected, and showed a strong inflammatory response.
Scientists also examined the adipose tissue of patients who died from covid and found coronavirus particles in the fat surrounding various organs.
It is known that HIV and flu viruses can hide in adipose tissue, using it as a reservoir, in an attempt to avoid an immune system response.
SARS-CoV-2 is probably also capable of doing this.
Biologist talks about the causes of dementia
Candidate of Biological Sciences Semyon Golosheikin named the causes of dementia and told about the ways to prevent it in an interview with Radio Sputnik.
According to WHO, more than 55 million people suffer from this disease.
The syndrome manifests itself as a gradual loss of cognitive functions - over time, a person has difficulty navigating even in familiar surroundings.
Golosheikin noted that neurodegenerative disorders, head injuries, some infections, metabolic disorders and lack of certain vitamins most often lead to dementia.
Some factors increase the risk of developing the disease.
These include hypertension, diabetes, high cholesterol, obesity, depression and alcoholism.
At the behavioral level, factors such as social isolation and lack of active cognitive activity may play a role," he said.
Bad habits like smoking, alcohol abuse, sleep disorders and sedentary lifestyle also influence the development of dementia.
Among the first signs, the expert noted forgetfulness, inability to concentrate and decreased abstract thinking.
"There is a debate that hearing loss can be both an early manifestation of Alzheimer's disease and one of the risk factors for its onset," the biologist added.
To prevent the onset of the disease, the WHO recommends maintaining adequate levels of exercise, training cognitive skills and abilities that require the involvement of memory and logic.
Earlier, professor of neurology, neurosurgery and medical genetics at the department of neurology, neurosurgery and medical genetics at the Pirogov Russian State Medical University.
N.I. Pirogov, Head of Cognitive Disorders Department of the Federal Brain and Neurotechnology Center Anna Bogolepova spoke about the causes of memory problems.
Egypt returned about 30 thousand illegally exported artifacts from the country
During the last 10 years the Government of Cairo managed to return about 30 thousand artifacts which were illegally taken out of the country.
Shaaban Abdel Gaouad, chief inspector of the Department of Returned Antiquities at the Egyptian Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities, said on Saturday, December 11, on air at Al-Hayat TV.
Since 2011, the Egyptian state has managed to return 29,300 artifacts.
This year alone, 5,300 monuments of ancient Egyptian civilization were discovered at the Museum of the Bible in Washington," he said.
Abdel Gaouad specified that all of the smuggled artifacts are registered in the archives.
Department officials are now working on their return to Egypt.
In particular, specialists "monitor auctions around the world and sales on the Internet" through foreign and Egyptian sites, as well as social networks.
The chief inspector said that upon return, the cultural property is restored and then exhibited in museums.
One of the returned artifacts, he said, was an ancient human skeleton discovered in Belgium, which is now part of an exhibit at the National Museum of Egyptian Civilization in Cairo.
In 2020, the Egyptian authorities asked Interpol to help find the bust of the pharaoh Tutankhamun sold at auction in London.
Auction house Christie's held an auction on July 4, at which the bust of more than 3 thousand years old was sold for $ 5.97 million (about 680 million rubles).
This caused dissatisfaction on the part of Egypt.
The Egyptian side also claims that the object of art was illegally removed in the 1970s from the Karnak temple in Luxor.
The head of Tutankhamun, depicted as the sun god Amon, was kept in a private collection and had not been put up for auction since 1985.
How did the relic get to Europe, is unknown.
Egypt in recent years is actively seeking to repatriate illegally exported from the country at various times monuments of antiquity.
According to the authorities, 95% of the smuggled antiquities are the result of archaeological investigations of "black diggers.

Crimean Tatars are a separate nation, and the name of this nation consists of two words!
They are united only by the Turkic language group.
FT: Credit Suisse wants access to employees' personal mobile devices
Credit Suisse wants its employees to give the bank access to their personal mobile devices, writes the Financial Times.
The fact is that in Europe and the U.S., the Swiss bank does not give its employees corporate communication devices, instead offering a discount on the purchase of a cell phone or smartphone from a partner - a telecommunications operator.
Under current rules, the bank can view information on corporate devices issued to its employees as they are used to resolve business issues with colleagues or clients.
The bank uses the right to check mobile devices in extreme cases - for example, if an employee has used it to conduct a meeting with a client that has not been approved by Credit Suisse.
Now, after many employees have switched to remote working, the bank wants to extend this rule to all devices that have been used for business matters.
According to the newspaper, bank management has set a deadline by which employees can familiarize themselves with the new rule.
Credit Suisse has not officially commented on the new requirement.
Sontelle Vivre Dual royal 70x200 mattress.
In the center of the Vivre Dual royal mattress is a high-quality and durable block of high self-contained springs TFK 18.
Natural coconut layers add stiffness, zonal latex ensures better distribution of the load, latex with the addition of Aloe ensures hygiene of the sleeping space, and the relief foam relaxes.
The mattress has a symmetrical medium firmness and a great height (30 cm).
The product comes packed in a tight roll and is ready for use a short time after unpacking.
The cover is made of durable knitted fabric with a comfort layer stitching.
The fabric of the cover does not wrinkle or stretch over time.
Part 4
The last year of Sergey Yesenin's life - 1925 - was fruitful in terms of creativity, but the hardest for the earthly existence of the poet and his "ego".
He is already out of any literary associations, splintered with Imagism, he is on his own, but known, in demand, at times firmly scolded by critics, even maliciously, but the reading public is ready to carry him in their arms.
During the year he wrote more than 60 poems, many of them were real masterpieces, completed the cycle "Persian Motives", wrote the poem "Anna Snegina", published 8 books, the collection "Soviet Russia".
And the main success - at the end of June 25, the State Publishing House signed a contract with Yesenin for the publication of his works in three volumes.
None of the contemporary poets was awarded such an honor - he was the first!
Besides, it promised very good money - according to the contract, the fee was 1000 rubles a month for 20 months (a factory director, for instance, received 300 rubles a month, an engineer - 200).
The funds in that year were needed more than ever.
Yesenin married Leo Tolstoy's granddaughter Sophia Tolstoy, it was necessary to arrange a family life, to support his sisters Katya and Sasha and his mother.
It would seem that life was getting better, there is something to rejoice in, but for him everything is painted mostly in dark colors, as if a nightmare from the poem "Black Man" (written in November 1925 and published after Yesenin's death) materialized:
My friend, my friend,
I am very, very ill.
I don't know where this pain comes from.
Is it the wind that's whistling
Over an empty and deserted field,
Or like a grove in September,
The alcohol that's been pouring into my brain.
Many acquaintances noted that Yesenin strongly deteriorated, did not look good, clearly ill.
Recurrent binges, nervous breakdowns.
And the reason is probably not only in alcoholism ...
However, if such a diagnosis - alcoholism - was made to Sergei Alexandrovich by someone, there are no reliable documents.
For example, those pertaining to May 1923, when Yesenin, at the insistence of his fourth wife, the American Isadora Duncan, was improving his health in a clinic outside Paris with Professor Peter Gannushkin (again, he would see him two years later, already in Moscow).
But there is enough evidence of the poet's drinking, of scandals on this basis, of his arrests by the police - scattered over dozens of memoirs.
Since the early 20s the poet's dreadful love affair with the green dragon had been rapidly developing.
At the end of the summer of 1923, Yesenin briefly stayed with a friend, the Imagist Ivan Startsev.
Surprisingly, but Yesenin with his very good income has never had his own place neither in Moscow nor in St. Petersburg, he found himself in rented apartments, hotels or with acquaintances.
Startsev recalls:
"He came only to spend the night, and in most cases in a deranged, drunken state.
One day, returning at four in the morning, Yesenin fell on the landing...
Falling, scratched his face and wheezed.
Come to himself a little, he coughing incessantly, splashing blood all over the sheet ... ".
Yes, and Yesenin himself after a voyage to Europe and the United States (in the States then was dry law, but Duncan took with him a decent supply of liquor) admitted:
"I didn't see anything there but taverns and streets...
By the end I stopped remembering people...
And I drank, of course...
And I drank because I was bored".
Tire Pirelli Scorpion Winter 265/45 R20 108V
Winter tire Pirelli Scorpion Winter on the basis of a high-strength mix of rubbers and silica ensures a long-term efficient operation, uniform wear and resistance to loads.
The linear tread pattern of Pirelli Scorpion Winter, forming ribs, guarantees low rolling resistance and directional stability.
Four deep grooves effectively remove water and dirt from the contact area of Pirelli Scorpion Winter tire, suppressing sliding and aquaplaning.
3D lamination enhances traction on slippery roads, snow and ice.
Large shoulder areas increase cross traction of the Pirelli Scorpion Winter tire when maneuvering, enhance traction and reduce braking distance.
Fine grooves and notches dissipate heat.
Promtex Orient Duet Latex Econom 100x195 mattress
Promtex-Orient Duet Latex Econom is a modern version of the budget model in the line of premium-class.
The basis of the mattress is a block of independent double springs Duet.
A softer spring of smaller size is inserted inside the large spring.
This allows to evenly distribute the load on the mattress.
On both sides the mattress is supplemented with the filler - artificial latex.
This is an analogue of natural latex, but it is denser and less expensive.
The flexibility and elasticity of this material increases the comfort effect of the mattress.
Artificial latex is hypoallergenic, it does not absorb moisture and dust.
The mattress is excellent for a couple with a big difference in weight (from 30 kilograms).
Due to the "smart" springs there is no ripple effect when the light partner rolls on the side of the heavy one.
The soft caress of practical Sense jacquard is stitched with a layer of sintepon.
The natural fabric does not accumulate static electricity.
This mattress model can be manufactured in the twisted version (vacuum roll-packaging).

Polish Foreign Ministry believes that Belarus is using migrants as a "weapon.
Polish Deputy Foreign Minister Pawel Jablonski believes that President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko has been using refugees as a "weapon" against the European Union and intends to return to this "operation" next year.
Deputy Foreign Minister made a statement to this effect in an interview to the Australian Financial Review.

It affected 17 individuals and 11 organizations.

Cover for clothes 60×100 cm, spunbond, color blue.
For your clothes to serve you for a long time, you need to properly care for them.
Proper storage will prolong its life and keep an attractive appearance.
A bag for clothes will help us in this!
The advantages.
Using a bag for clothes, you significantly save space.
This is especially true if you have a lot of things and a small closet.
Tidy appearance.
No more dresses, blouses and skirts hanging in random places.
Neat slipcovers allow you to sort your clothes and hide them from view.
For people who use racks instead of a regular closet, this is the best option.
The cover reliably protects your clothes from dust, dirt, insects, mechanical damage, or possible fading.
Does not let the clothes change its shape during long storage, prevents the formation of fractures.
Features of covers for clothes.
Special material allows your clothes to "breathe".
With careful handling, the service life of such a cover is not limited.
They can store not only clothes, but also blankets, pillows, linens.
The cover is "sealed" with a strong zipper.
Important to remember!
Pre-prepare things for storage for a long time: clean them, straighten the folds.
Choose the best size for your case: things should not bend at the bottom.
It is not recommended to hang several large things in one case at once: they can crumple.
If you value order and neatness, value your belongings, want to keep them and extend their life - order a bag for your clothes.

"The wrong man's hat": when a velvet jacket makes a man a laughing stock
Velvet jackets dominated social events in 2021.
Perhaps the first to announce his new fashion decision was Daniel Craig.
Back in September at the premiere of "No Time to Die" he appeared in a velvet crimson jacket and a traditional "Bond" bowtie.
He was followed twice by Prince William, who first wore an inappropriate green velvet blazer to The Earthshot Prize eco-award ceremony and then opted for a more classic version for an event supporting the Royal Variety charity.
A couple of weeks ago, Lionel Messiah also tried on the trend.
The footballer came to pick up his seventh Ballon d'Or in a Dolce & Gabbana velvet jacket.
By the way, his sons wore the same.
AliExpress is already noticing a growing demand for velvet men's jackets in Russia.
According to the analysts of the service, received by "Gazeta.Ru", they have been bought 1.4 times more often.
The most popular are warm velvet jackets with lining and fitted silhouette, the main colors are dark beige, burgundy, navy blue and, of course, black.
The average price of such models - from 3 to 6 thousand rubles. In this case, men prefer to buy only jackets - Velvet suits sets they choose less often.
You can buy them not only from online retailers.
Budget options are available at H&M, Mango, Next and Zara.
In the luxury segment velvet jackets this season are presented practically in all brands - Brioni, Paul Smith, Etro, Saint Laurent.
The most coveted model is considered Gucci, which brand ambassador Jared Leto wore at one of the premieres of the film "House of Gucci".
Choosing the jackets of expensive brands, you can be sure that the velvet is made of silk.
Thanks to a special technology of interlacing threads a dense fabric with a tufted exterior texture and a smooth interior is obtained.
More budget versions are made of cotton or polyamide, but, accordingly, serve less.
Lamoda fashion expert Ilya Vakhoshkin, warns that in the case of a velvet jacket, the main thing is not its model or style, but relevance.
"Velvet requires evening light, so such a jacket is ideal if you are going to a party or a formal event," explains Vakhoshkin. - It is suitable also for those cases, if in the invitation the dress-code "Black Tie" or "Creative Black Tie" is specified.
Another important criterion, the observance of which allows making a choice in favor of a velvet jacket, is the status of his buyer.
"A man in a velvet jacket, first of all, must acquire the right advanced hangout with affluence," say the authors of the Telegram channel about men's fashion "Handsome Brammell. - The owners of velvet jackets tend to belong to the caste of those people who rarely buy tickets.
They are simply invited to timed social events, where the dress code is always specified.
Ilya Vakhoshkin suggests combining a velvet jacket with the same smart things: classic pants with arrows, solid color shirts, silk ties, loafers with tassels, cufflinks.
Things that are too simple and casual will look out of place.
Fashion experts from "Handsome Brammell" are sure: the appearance of an ordinary employee in a velvet jacket at a corporate party will also be inappropriate, but if we are talking about "the head of those who run this event - "yes", for him such a thing in the theme.
If the employee is of a lower rank, but his aim is to move up in a complex company hierarchy or to knock out financial bonuses, it is better to not wear a velvet jacket.
The management will definitely assess this with the phrase "the wrong man for the wrong hat", - think the editors of the Telegram-channel about men's fashion.

It is an unnatural timbre, so forcedly drawn.
And it is not associated with a pretty face of a young girl.
To be honest, I do not understand the admiration of others.
But with all my heart I wish you good luck in life!

Immunologist says revaccination in four to five months will help protect against the "omicron" strain of coronavirus
Revaccination in four to five months can protect against a new strain of coronavirus infection "omicron".
This statement was made by immunologist Nikolai Kryuchkov, who called vaccination in six months, given the emergence of the new strain, "a very long period."
"With previous strains, such a period was normal, but now it is best to conduct the procedure in five months, and for people with chronic diseases - in four," the expert said, calling for a revaccination campaign in parallel with the vaccination campaign.
Kryuchkov also noted that early revaccination provides a good titer of neutralizing antibodies.
"If a person has had two vaccinations and a booster, or has been over-vaccinated and over-vaccinated, or vaccinated and over-vaccinated, then he or she has received 'hybrid immunity,' that is, antibodies are plentiful and neutralizing enough," the expert specified.
"G7" warned Russia of "large-scale consequences" in the case of an invasion of Ukraine
The "Big Seven" countries (Great Britain, Germany, Italy, Canada, USA, France and Japan) published a statement after the meeting of the foreign ministers in Liverpool.
It stressed that Russia's "military aggression" against Ukraine "will have enormous consequences and will cost Moscow dearly," but the document did not describe specific measures.
"We, the foreign ministers of Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom and the United States, and the High Representative of the European Union, are united in our condemnation of Russia's military build-up and aggressive rhetoric against Ukraine," the statement said.
The ministers further urged Russia to "de-escalate, use diplomatic channels and comply with its international obligations regarding military transparency," as U.S. President Biden said during a Dec. 7 video call to Russian President Putin.
"We reaffirm our support for the efforts of France and Germany in the Normandy format to achieve full implementation of the Minsk agreements to resolve the conflict in eastern Ukraine," the G7 foreign ministers also said.
Any use of force to change borders is strictly prohibited by international law.
Russia should have no doubt that further military aggression against Ukraine will have enormous consequences and a serious price to pay in return," they warn.
We reaffirm our unwavering commitment to Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity, and to the right of any sovereign state to determine its own future.
We welcome Ukraine's restrained position.
We will intensify our cooperation on our common and comprehensive response," the statement also said.
Earlier in the day, the head of British diplomacy, Elizabeth Truss, said that Russia would face "serious consequences" if it invades Ukraine.
She said the meeting showed "a united voice of the G7 countries, which account for 50 percent of world GDP and have made it very clear that an invasion of Ukraine would have enormous consequences for Russia."
Pfizer vaccine found to be 32 times less effective against Omicron strain
The effectiveness of the vaccine from the company Pfizer-BioNTech against the omicron strain of coronavirus is 32 times less effective compared to other types of the disease.
This is the conclusion reached by scientists from the University of Hong Kong and the Chinese University of Hong Kong, the South China Morning Post (SCMP) reports.
The vaccine was found to be less effective based on a study of antiviral activity in citizens who received two doses of the drug from COVID-19.
"We see that most people had high levels of antiviral activity against the original Sars-CoV-2 variant, but this ability was significantly reduced against the omicron variant," Professor Malik Peiris told SCMP.
At the same time, the scientists stressed that the vaccination remains the most reliable way to protect against the serious course of the disease when infected with coronavirus.
Earlier, scientists at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine predicted the development of a coronavirus pandemic, taking into account the impact of the omicron strain.
The authors of the study concluded that the omicron strain could cause a new wave of virus circulation and increased mortality if additional measures are not taken.
Ukrainian Defense Minister accused the FRG of blocking NATO arms deliveries to Kiev
Ukrainian Defense Minister Oleksiy Reznikov accused the government of former German Chancellor Angela Merkel of blocking Kiev's acquisition of lethal weapons within NATO.
In an interview with the Financial Times on December 12, Reznikov recalled that last month Germany vetoed Ukraine's purchase of anti-sniper systems and anti-drone rifles.
However, it is noted that Berlin later softened its stance on the rifles, recognizing them as non-lethal weapons.
According to the defense minister, Kiev intends to seek to acquire the aforementioned weapons as part of bilateral agreements with its allies.
In particular, the USA, the UK, Lithuania and France are involved.
Meanwhile, the FT notes that the position of the new German government led by Chancellor Olaf Scholz on allowing arms supplies to Ukraine remains unclear.
Earlier on Sunday, Ukraine's ambassador to Germany Andriy Melnyk expressed the opinion that Kiev should not expect Berlin to supply arms under Chancellor Scholz.
According to him, the previous FRG leadership explained its refusal to provide weapons by the risk of a military escalation of the conflict in Donbas, despite Russia's "occupation" of part of Ukrainian territory.
The diplomat is sure that Germany will maintain the same "illogical" position under the new chancellor.
In August, Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelensky said that Kiev expects help from Berlin to equip its navy.
Ukraine expects Germany "to be a partner of Ukraine in the technical sense," the president added.
It was also noted that Robert Habek, co-chairman of the Green Party of Germany, visited the republic this spring, where he advocated the sale of defensive armaments to Kiev.

Game set "Fishing": e / f light, sound, included playing field, 2 rods, 5 figures, battery. 3 AA not included, Kor.
Electric children's fishing - a fun and useful toy for child development.
While playing, your child will exercise fine motor skills, develop dexterity, accuracy and attention.
Once the toy is turned on, 5 miniature fish start to move briskly through the simulated pond to a cheerful melody.
The task of the child - to catch them all on the hook!
You can play by yourself or together: the kit includes 2 fishing rods.
The toy runs on 3 1.5 V AA batteries (not included).

The product is made of plastic.

In Moscow, they've named the winners of the Arsenyev Award - Rossiyskaya Gazeta
Awarding ceremony for the winners of the third season of the All-Russian literary prize "The Far East" named after Arsenyev - Rossiyskaya Gazeta.
В. K. Arsenyev was held in Moscow.
According to the prize page on Instagram, the organizing committee received a total of 89 applications this season.
The selection has passed 63.
The leaders in the number of submitted works were Primorsky and Khabarovsk regions - 13 and 11 applications.
More than 60 works in three nominations: "Long prose", "Short prose" and "Prose for children" were nominated.
Nine works were shortlisted - three in each category.
Alexander Filkin (Primorsky Krai) won in the "Long Prose" category with his book "Gospel Inscription.
The award was presented to the winner by Yury Trutnev, the Deputy Prime Minister and Presidential Plenipotentiary Envoy to the Far Eastern Federal District.
The winner in the category "Short Prose" was Lyubov Bezbakh (Sakhalin Region) with her work "Whispering of Night Rain.
She received the award from Alexey Chekunkov, Minister of the Russian Federation for the Development of the Far East and the Arctic.
Trans-Baikal writer Nina Belomestnova and her "Golden Thread" won in the category "Children's Prose".
The author was awarded by the screenwriter, writer, candidate of philological sciences and chairman of the jury of the Prize Andrey Gelasimov.
All winners will receive 500 thousand rubles.
Let's remind, within the limits of the award "The Far East" authors of the best works on the Far East subjects are awarded.
The basic task of the award is not only to award winners and to tell about modern authors, but also to draw cultural interest to the Far East as territory of priority development of the XXI century.
Novels, novellas, collections of novellas or stories, as well as documentary prose and memoirs can be nominated.
The author's place of residence doesn't matter, the main thing is to write in Russian.
The official website of the prize is: https://премияарсеньева.рф/.

"Mercedes has lodged a protest against the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix
The German Mercedes team, whose driver Lewis Hamilton at the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix finished second behind Red Bull driver Max Verstappen, has filed a protest against the final result of the race, according to the press service of the Formula 1.
"Mercedes believes that Formula One rules 48.12 and 48.8 were violated during the race.
In the first case, the German team is challenging the judges' decision to return lap drivers to one lap with the leaders.
According to the second - Verstappen was ahead of Hamilton to the allowed "restart" zone.
We should add that now the result of the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, according to which Verstappen beat Hamilton by 2.256 seconds and won the world championship of Formula 1 are preliminary, when will be considered protests "Mercedes" is not known
G7 warned Russia of responsibility for invasion of Ukraine
G7 foreign ministers warned of "serious consequences" for Russia if it continues military aggression against Ukraine, the parties said in a final statement.
The meeting also noted that they condemned the strengthening of the Russian armed forces near the country's borders.
"Russia should have no doubt that further military aggression against Ukraine will have serious consequences and serious costs," said a statement published on the U.K. government website.
G7 ministers and the EU high representative said they were "united in their condemnation of Russia's armed escalation and aggressive rhetoric against Ukraine."
British Foreign Secretary Elizabeth Truss at a press conference in Liverpool warned of "great consequences" for Russia in the event of an invasion of Ukraine.
We have made it clear that any invasion would have significant consequences...
The G7 wants Russia to renounce aggression towards Ukraine," she said (quoted by TASS).
Earlier at the Liverpool summit, G7 foreign ministers agreed that the parties needed to return to the negotiating table to resolve the crisis over the Russian troop build-up on the border with Ukraine.
They were talking about negotiations in the Normandy format.
The North Atlantic Alliance was also in favor of dialogue on Ukraine in the Normandy format.
Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said that by calling on Russia and Ukraine to return to the negotiating table, the G7 countries "signed themselves incapable of taking responsibility for their own mistakes.
